channel.title: 100 Words Or Less: The Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: Host Ray Harkins dives deep with creators of independent culture from musicians, artists and other interesting people to find out what inspires them, how they came to be and many other unexpected places.

item.title: Mat Kerekes from Citizen & Isa Holliday from Slow Crush - Live from Outbreak
item.itunes:title: Mat Kerekes from Citizen & Isa Holliday from Slow Crush - Live from Outbreak
item.description:
The very last in our installment of live podcasts that I did at the almighty Outbreak Fest in June of 2022 in front of a live audience. These two chats were awesome and of course, with great people involved in independent music. The first one is with Mat Kerekes from Citizen in which we discuss video games, working out and UK audiences. Then, I chat with Isa Holliday from Slow Crush as they were wrapping up a whirlwind world tour that was so ambitious I admired it from afar. We got into her background, why they love guitar pedals and a lot more. 

Buy Podcast Merch Here

Theme Song by Tapestry Gold

item.title: Ben Jorgensen from Armor For Sleep
item.itunes:title: Ben Jorgensen from Armor For Sleep
item.description:
Early 2000's emo/post-hardcore will never die! While nostalgia is a powerful drug, Ben and his band Armor For Sleep don't just rest on their laurels, they release a killer new LP and play shows around it. I am glad to welcome Ben into the fold and have deep conversations with him about putting on shows at 13 years old, how cool pop punk is and the positive and negatives of "people pleasing". 

Buy Podcast Merch Here

item.title: Walter Schreifels from Quicksand / Will Yip
item.itunes:title: Walter Schreifels from Quicksand / Will Yip
item.description:
LIVE FROM OUTBREAK FEST 2022! 

We have two luminaries within our scene, Walter from Quicksand/Rival Schools (and so much more) and Will Yip the producer of many of your favorite records (Title Fight, Balance and Composure, Pianos Become the Teeth and SO MUCH MORE). We had these discussions in front of a live studio audience and it was quite a fun discussion about navigating creative roadblocks, longevity in music and work ethic. Pull up a chair and enjoy!

item.title: Stephen Christian from Anberlin
item.itunes:title: Stephen Christian from Anberlin
item.description:
"Like Hoobastank...but doesn't suck" are some immortal words a friend of mine said about Anberlin and I will never forget that. I was pleased as punch to tell Stephen that over our internet connection conversation (to be clear, I like Hoobastank). We get in deep with the feeling of being an outcast, the difference between "shows" and "concerts" and the business side of music. It's a wide ranging discussion and think you will find some value in here. Enjoy!

item.title: Bjorn Dossche from Rise and Fall, Chain Reaction and Wrong Man
item.itunes:title: Bjorn Dossche from Rise and Fall, Chain Reaction and Wrong Man
item.description:
Rise and Fall is an often overlooked, but incredibly important band to the punk and hardcore scene not only in the US but worldwide. Hailing from Belgium (you can laugh at my outro to this episode saying how much I love Swedish hardcore and then after the fact LOL'ing but deciding to leave it in), Bjorn Dossche sang for the band and I had to bring him on the show. We discussed a lot of things including the Belgian hardcore scene, US touring and keeping things comfortable. Let's get it! 

Check out his new band Wrong Man! 

Buy Podcast Merch Here

item.title: Geoff Rowley, professional skateboarder
item.itunes:title: Geoff Rowley, professional skateboarder
item.description:
One of my favorite skaters of all time, Geoff Rowley, is on the show this week. To say I am thrilled is an understatement. His parts in legendary skate videos like 411 and others not only got me stoked on his talent but the music he chose was always a bit different and always hit the punk/hardcore/metal side of things real hard. I knew his affinity for the music runs deep, but how deep I didn't know until now. We discuss his feelings around being a video game character, Discord Records and so much more. Enjoy the listen! 

Buy Podcast Merch Here

item.title: Chris Higdon from Elliott, Frontiers and Falling Forward
item.itunes:title: Chris Higdon from Elliott, Frontiers and Falling Forward
item.description:
HAPPY 10 YEARS TO THE PODCAST! 

All hyperbole aside, this podcast has changed my life for the better and thanks for coming along this journey and love letter to independent music. We make it VERY special by having a white whale guest hanging out this week in the form of Chris Higdon from the almighty (and recently reunited) Elliott! I chased him down for the past 3 years and only recently started popping up in podcasts, so I HAD TO HAVE HIM. We talk about his past bands (Falling Forward, Frontiers), dressing up at shows and being low profile. It was everything I wanted and more. Hope you dig! 

Buy Podcast Merch Here

item.title: Dan Tracy from Deafheaven and Anthony Anzaldo from Ceremony
item.itunes:title: Dan Tracy from Deafheaven and Anthony Anzaldo from Ceremony
item.description:
Live From Outbreak Fest 2022 we have two amazing humans on this episode. First up, I have Dan Tracy from Deafheaven on to discuss our shared history playing in bands, why no one talks to drummers and tour tips. Right after that, Anthony Anzaldo from Ceremony (fresh off an airline losing his key-tar) comes in to chat about the longevity of the band, how UK audiences receive the band and playing in Cold Cave. Great times and won't you come join us?

item.title: Georgia Rawson from Dscvrd Magazine
item.itunes:title: Georgia Rawson from Dscvrd Magazine
item.description:
Let's talk print media!  One of my favorite publications around is called Dscvrd Magazine and it's editor in chief is a new friend of mine, Georgia Rawson! The magazine is celebrating it's 10 year anniversary and I wanted to pick her brain about all things journalism, supporting bands from the start and not being "afraid" of the business implications of music. I learned a lot and I think you will as well. Enjoy!

item.title: Kat Moss from Scowl & Anaiah Lei/Dez Yusuf from Zulu (live from Outbreak Fest)
item.itunes:title: Kat Moss from Scowl & Anaiah Lei/Dez Yusuf from Zulu (live from Outbreak Fest)
item.description:
LIVE FROM OUTBREAK FEST 2022! 

I am so excited to be releasing all of these great discussions to you that I had at the festival and this one in particular was PRETTY, PRETTY GOOD (insert Larry David voice here). First up is a return guest, Kat Moss from Scowl and right after that we have Anaiah & Dez from Zulu on. Both are wide ranging discussions about representation in hardcore, the observations of playing to vastly different audiences and a lot more. Enjoy!

item.title: Jesse Barnett from Stick To Your Guns
item.itunes:title: Jesse Barnett from Stick To Your Guns
item.description:
Welp, it's been close to 10 years since I had Jesse on the pod so it felt like a great time to check back in with him and look how both he and the band have grown and changed over that time. We get in depth about his conflicts on social media, the importance of his work with the community bookstore he runs called All Power Books  and their increased popularity in Europe. I love the guy and this conversation was special to me. Enjoy!

item.title: Olli Appleyard from Static Dress & Kadeem France from Loathe (Live from Outbreak Fest 2022)
item.itunes:title: Olli Appleyard from Static Dress & Kadeem France from Loathe (Live from Outbreak Fest 2022)
item.description:
LIVE FROM OUTBREAK FEST 2022

We have two great chats with some UK peeps on this weeks podcast. First up is Olli Appleyard from the up and coming band Static Dress who was FRESH off their performance and we joke about it up top. Olli was a great discussion.

Secondly, I have Kadeem France from the post-metal (I just made this up) band Loathe. Kadeem and I didn't know each other at all, but got along real proper and what a cool story he has. 

Massive thanks to the Outbreak Festival people and Simon who helped capture the audio on the stage! 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Andy Norton from Praise
item.itunes:title: Andy Norton from Praise
item.description:
Praise. What a band! I have loved the band ever since their "Lights Went Out" LP and it's been a fun ride watching the band evolve and frankly, get better and now we are here with Andy Norton, the vocalist of Praise. We discuss taking creativity seriously, how to work with friends and writing lyrics.

item.title: Adam McGrath from Cave In
item.itunes:title: Adam McGrath from Cave In
item.description:
Cave In are legendary. I don't use that word lightly but very few bands have been able to sustain their place in the music scene, evolve sonically and continue to put out some of their best material to date. That being said, I had to chat with Adam McGrath to discuss his life in the Merrimack Valley hardcore scene, early tour stories and being stubborn. It's an all encompassing discussion that I love to have and hope you enjoy! 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
Cave In are legendary. I don't use that word lightly but very few bands have been able to sustain their place in the music scene, evolve sonically and continue to put out some of their best material to date. That being said, I had to chat with Adam McGrath to discuss his life in the Merrimack Valley hardcore scene, early tour stories and being stubborn. It's an all encompassing discussion that I love to have and hope you enjoy!

item.itunes:title: Jason Mazzola from Count Me Out, Cloak/Dagger and Where It Went Podcast
item.description:
We have an absolute treat this week with the appearance of my friend Jason Mazzola on the podcast. He sang for a band called Count Me Out, currently sings for a band called Cloak/Dagger as well as the host of Where It Went Podcast (a deep dive into the Revelation Records catalog). As you can see, he's a busy dude but we found time to hang hard and discuss what it's like being podcast nerds, how amazing Chain of Strength is and trying to not be overly nostalgic.

item.description:

We go deep on pursing art, skateboarding and his life in the military. Peep it and enjoy!

item.title: Don Devore from Ink and Dagger, Frail and Collapsing Scenery
item.itunes:title: Don Devore from Ink and Dagger, Frail and Collapsing Scenery
item.description:
I am proud to bring you this very metaphysical chat with Don Devore who is the guitarist for Ink and Dagger, Frail and Collapsing Scenery (among many other projects). Ink and Dagger were huge for me personally and I celebrate their entire catalog and Frail was such a force of nature for the early screamo/hardcore scene that I was stoked Don wanted to talk about that. We go in about how chaotic the Ink and Dagger experience was, creating art at all costs and of course, Vampires. Love the discussion and I hope you do as well. 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

We go deep into his family history in the oil biz, his experience with the reunion shows with Mineral as well as being an introvert. I love all his music and hope you gain a deeper appreciation of it after this conversation.

item.title: Milo Auckerman from Descendents
item.itunes:title: Milo Auckerman from Descendents
item.description:
We are here! 500 episodes and still trucking. I am so pleased to bring you this discussion with a gem of a human being and a formative figure to mine (and many others) upbringing within punk/hardcore, Milo Auckerman from Descendents. We discuss science, ego and of course the optimal amount of coffee to drink in a day. We also peel back the story of how they ended up in the cult classic film, "Pump Up The Volume" with Christian Slater. Thanks to all listening and supporting! This podcast has changed my life and I am so appreciative of it. Viva DIY music! 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Tomas Lijedahl from Breach and Norna
item.description:
I am so stoked to bring you this discussion with Tomas Lijedahl from Norna and Breach. If you are a fan of anything heavy that resembles Isis, Neurosis and the like, you absolutely have to listen to Tomas' new band, Norna as well as his previous band called Breach. We talk in depth about the Swedish hardcore scene, skate punk and disfunction. He's an open book and I was thankful to be able to have this chat.

item.title: Patrick Carrie from Limbeck
item.itunes:title: Patrick Carrie from Limbeck
item.description:
If Patrick and his band don't bring you a smile, I don't know what to do to help you but I have faith in you. I brought Patrick on the show to discuss his south OC upbringing, ska zines and how Limbeck sat squarely at the intersection of being "too punk for country and too country for punk". He also tells us of some wild advertising stories that he and his friends participated in. Listen and enjoy!

We accomplished that and discussed how sick Portland is, the art of booking shows and how important MySpace-core was for music tastes of the early 2000's. Emma was a great hang and enjoy our discussion!

item.description:
Jason Black plays in the legendary punk/pump your fist in the air band, Hot Water Music. They just released their new full length on Equal Vision Records entitled "Feel The Void" that is well...incredible. Jason opens up about the band attempting to "fit in" at certain points of their career, his relationship with touring and being in a working class band. Listen and enjoy!

item.itunes:title: Bobby Markos from Cloakroom and Lost Speedways
item.description:
Post rock. Relapse. NASCAR? All of these things are covered in today's pod with the dude, Bobby Markos from Cloakroom. I love this band's blend of Hum, meets stoner rock meets Isis. It's got it all and I was happy to pick Bobby's brain on their origins, how sick his old band Native was and he explains to me the allure of NASCAR for him and his work with the legendary race car driver Dale Earnhardt Jr.

item.itunes:title: Joey Cahill from Wanna Hear It Records
item.description:

Donate to Global Giving to benefit the citizens of the Ukraine.

item.title: Marco Walzel from Avocado Booking
item.itunes:title: Marco Walzel from Avocado Booking
item.description:
Back in the saddle this week with my long time friend and incredible human being, Marco Walzel. He's the owner and operator of the highly respected (and successful) booking agency, Avocado Booking who has booked tours for years for bands like Comeback Kid, Parkway Drive, August Burns Red and so much more...plus, he's a hardcore kid! We discuss his time singing for a band called My Hero Died Today that made some waves, growing up in Germany and the difference in touring through Europe vs the US. Get to know Marco and listen in!

We get into Connecticut hardcore, growing up musically in public and being active in the scene. Have fun!

item.title: Mario Rubalcaba from Rocket From the Crypt/Hot Snakes/Earthless
item.itunes:title: Mario Rubalcaba from Rocket From the Crypt/Hot Snakes/Earthless
item.description:
Mario Rubalcaba is an incredible drummer and he has played in some of my favorite bands, which by default makes him one of my favorite drummers. Joking aside, I was excited to have a conversation with Mario about his time as a pro skater, the early 90's punk and hardcore scene as well as how he's collaborated with so many people across a wide variety of musical projects. Listen and enjoy!

(programming note, my microphone cord was broken so it was picking up my backup audio, so I sound a little distant...sorry about that!)

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Ken Shipley from Numero Group
item.itunes:title: Ken Shipley from Numero Group
item.description:
I am privileged to bring on Ken Shipley, the co-founder of an incredible label called Numero Group that specializes in releasing and archiving music of all styles including (and not limited to) Northern Soul, Gospel, Folk and more recently early screamo. Their re-issues of some seminal recordings from Codine, Karate, Indian Summer and more made me fall in love with the label even deeper so I HAD to have Ken on the podcast. We discussed his upbringing in the punk/hardcore scene, his curation roots and the process (for him) of putting out records.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Dan Ozzi, author and writer
item.itunes:title: Dan Ozzi, author and writer
item.description:
You read right? You should because it's like...really fun and stuff. One person you should definitely become intimately familiar with is the author, music nerd and all around good guy, Dan Ozzi. He just released a new book called Sellout in which he chronicles all the up's and down's of bands from our beloved indie community jumping into the big pond of MAJOR LABELS. Joking aside, Dan's book is a incredible piece of work and I had to have him on the pod to punish him about Staten Island, The Cable Car Theory, writing and so much more.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Geoff Garlock from Orchid and Panthers
item.itunes:title: Geoff Garlock from Orchid and Panthers
item.description:
A man of many talents, Geoff Garlock from Orchid, Panthers and his most recent project Low Estate comes to hang with us this week. He's also the host of such podcasts like Docs Till Death and The Cannon Canon so as you can see, he's a busy dude. We discuss his history with comedy, growing up with Connecticut hardcore and the "glory days" of Vice. It's a really fun discussion so pull up a chair and come hang out.

item.itunes:title: Karl Hensel from Kings Road Merch & Desperate Acts
item.description:
I'd love to welcome my friend Karl Hensel on the podcast today. He runs the show at Kings Road Merch (you have undoubtedly ordered vinyl or shirts from them in the past) and plays in a band called Desperate Acts. He's a music industry lifer (with Kings Road and previously with Bridge Nine Records) and spent a lot of time on the road with Holding On and Martyr AD and I was happy to pick his brain about that journey. Enjoy!

Hot damn! We have Brian Cook from Russian Circles, Botch and most recently, his newly released solo project Torment & Glory on the podcast this week. item.itunes:title: Dale Crover from The Melvins
item.description:
Dale from The (damn!) Melvins is hanging with us on the podcast today. It's a wide ranging chat that hits on life in Aberdeen, playing the drums and working within the major label system not to mention how the band has been able to make a career out of being adventurous musically. Dale also does a killer Keith Morris impression as well.

item.itunes:title: Mike Kinsella from Owen/American Football/Cap N’ Jazz
item.description:
Mr. Mike Kinsella is on the damn podcast today. The man behind bands like American Football, Owen, Cap' N' Jazz and Owls agreed to let me punish him for an hour and I was happy to oblige. We discuss the unexpected rise of American Football, being resilient and of course, midwest emo. In all honesty, I was thrilled to have this conversation because his music has been highly influential in my life.

item.itunes:title: Kevin Kiley from Lurk

item.title: Erik Ratensperger from Jeromes Dream
item.itunes:title: Erik Ratensperger from Jeromes Dream
item.description:
All hail Jeromes Dream! The kings of OG screamo have been back in action since 2019 and now are collecting all of their older material for a deluxe re-release on Iodine Recordings so in turn, I had to have my old friend and drummer of the band on the show. Erik reminisces about being in the early days of the early 2000's screamo scene, existing as a band today and the ties that bind the DIY community.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Gentry Densley from Iceburn
item.itunes:title: Gentry Densley from Iceburn
item.description:
We take a deep dive today into Salt Lake City and specifically with my new friend, Gentry Densley. He plays in a band called Iceburn (and many more) and is a staple in the SLC heavy music scene and I couldn't have been more excited to pick his brain about the band and scene in general. We also discuss Iceburn's tour with The Offspring (yep, that happened) as well as his continual quest to push boundaries within heavy music. He's a warm hearted dude and love to bring this chat to you all.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
Belgian Hardcore represent! I have Colin H. van Eeckhout from Amenra (who are much more than a hardcore band mind you) on the podcast today to talk about so many things including the longevity of the band (over 20 years!), transitioning into being a "full time" band and of course, the Belgian hardcore scene and him getting into heavy music. I just got into the band and feel dumb for not checking them out sooner, but I am glad I did.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Adam D from Times of Grace and Killswitch Engage
item.itunes:title: Adam D from Times of Grace and Killswitch Engage
item.description:
Everyone's favorite class clown of metal, Adam D is on the pod this week! He's an incredibly prolific musician playing guitar in Killswitch Engage and Times of Grace and a producer of many of your favorite records. We dig in deep to his first band, Aftershock, his life in and around the Massachusetts hardcore scene as well as his sense of humor. Good times were had by all and hope you enjoy this episode!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Matt Caughthran from The Bronx
item.itunes:title: Matt Caughthran from The Bronx
item.description:
Oh hell yes, Matt from The Bronx/Mariachi El Bronx is hanging with me on the podcast today. We get into it by discussing his life growing up in Los Angeles, how important 90's punk was to him as he started to develop his own music tastes and the insane times that he experienced when The Bronx was in the middle of a major label bidding war at the start of the band. Check it out!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Joe Mulherin from Nothing, Nowhere
item.itunes:title: Joe Mulherin from Nothing, Nowhere
item.description:
The man who invented "emo rap" is on the show today, Joe Mulherin from Nothing, Nowhere! Obviously I am poking fun a bit at the hyperbole there but this chat was spectacular. Joe is a real ass dude that has a lot of experience within the punk/hardcore subculture, is vegan and straight edge which maybe from the surface...you wouldn't pick up on. We had a lively discussion about all of those things and more. Dive in and enjoy this discussion!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Matt Frazier from Local Natives
item.itunes:title: Matt Frazier from Local Natives
item.description:
I love bringing episodes like this to you all because it came DIRECTLY FROM A LISTENER. Matt Frazier plays drums in the really great indie rock band Local Natives and he grew up in and around the punk/hardcore (specifically in the "Chain Reaction-core" days) scene so we dig deep into that while also discussing his life growing up in the Inland Empire, how close the band is as well as stalking Radiohead (not really, but it's a fun story). Listen and enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Mike Schleibaum from Darkest Hour and Be Well
item.itunes:title: Mike Schleibaum from Darkest Hour and Be Well
item.description:
The DUDE is on the podcast this week. By the DUDE I mean Mr. Mike Schliebaum who is the lead shredder in metal stalwarts Darkest Hour, Be Well and Battery. He's an incredibly prolific musician and someone who I call a friend. We talk about his new signature guitar, being an "asshole" and how he finds himself fitting in. What an episode!

item.title: Kevin Seconds from 7 Seconds
item.itunes:title: Kevin Seconds from 7 Seconds
item.description:
This week on the podcast we have the legend Kevin Seconds on the show. We discuss the re-issue of their seminal record, The Crew and what it was like growing up in Reno. He also talks about the fact he never wants to be the "old guy on the porch" when it comes to music. I couldn't be more excited to share so I hope you enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Greg Anderson from Engine Kid/Southern Lord Records/Sunn 0))
item.itunes:title: Greg Anderson from Engine Kid/Southern Lord Records/Sunn 0))
item.description:
A Pacific Northwest hardcore/metal legend, Greg Anderson is on the show this week. He played in Engine Kid, Brotherhood, currently runs Southern Lord Records and also plays in Sunn 0))) and Goatsnake. In short, he's done a ton of rad stuff within independent music, so I asked him all the questions. We covered the inception of the PNW hardcore scene, commercial success and musical isolation.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Brian Fair from Overcast/Shadows Fall
item.itunes:title: Brian Fair from Overcast/Shadows Fall
item.description:
New England Metal and Hardcore staple Brian Fair from Shadows Fall/Overcast is on the show this week! I am VERY excited as I have admired his work for many years and worked alongside of him when he played in Shadows Fall (I worked at Century Media while they were releasing their earlier LP's) but never got to spend time with him. We changed that and discussed a ton of things like his early touring life, his diverse music tastes and of course, his dreadlocks. GO!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Brian Moss from The Ghost/Hanalei
item.itunes:title: Brian Moss from The Ghost/Hanalei
item.description:
Today we have Brian Moss the band behind Hanalei and the underrated band, The Ghost. I love both of his bands so when the opportunity to have him on the show came up, I jumped at it. Brian and I discuss his experience being a working class band, his occupation as a teacher and how important the outdoors is to his well-being. He just released his latest full length with Hanalei called "Black Snow" and I urge you to check it out.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Mike Hranica from The Devil Wears Prada
item.itunes:title: Mike Hranica from The Devil Wears Prada
item.description:
Mike Hranica from The Devil Wears Prada joins me on the podcast today. I have always been fascinated by this band from their meteoric rise to capture the attention of the early 2000's metalcore/Christian scenes and moving quickly onto the Warped Tour stages across the country...the band definitely always had something to say. Now, heading into the bands 16th year of existence, they keep pushing their comfort zones and evolving. Mike and I discuss his process of writing a book, detaching his ego from his position in the band and so much more. Enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Chris Evenson from Sensefield
item.itunes:title: Chris Evenson from Sensefield
item.description:
Sensefield is an amazing band. They were huge in my early years of understanding that I could indeed listen to music that wasn't just screaming at me. I had the opportunity to bring on Chris Evanson the guitarist of the band on the podcast to discuss their "lost" record on Warner Brothers, his exposure to South Bay punk and the idea of them being a "bridge" band. Listen and enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Marshall Gallagher from Teenage Wrist
item.itunes:title: Marshall Gallagher from Teenage Wrist
item.description:
Let's talk about a cool new band okay? I fell in love with Teenage Wrist in 2018 when they dropped their first LP called "Chrome Neon Jesus" on my unsuspecting ears and it's this weird combo of Failure/Hum/Hoobastank (no joking) but simply put it just rocks. They just dropped a new heater called "Earth Is A Black Hole" and I had to have someone in the band on the show. Cue Marshall Gallagher and we dive deep into the bands history, his life on the road with 3OH3! (yes, that one) and growing up in the Denver suburbs. Even if you've never heard the band, you will find something to enjoy in this discussion.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Vince Averill from Cross Control, Capsule & Abiology Records and We Watch Wrestling Podcast
item.itunes:title: Vince Averill from Cross Control, Capsule & Abiology Records and We Watch Wrestling Podcast
item.description:
Boy, this chat was a treat. Vince Averill is the vocalist for Cross Control and one of the co-hosts of We Watch Wrestling Podcast but his roots in punk/hardcore go deep with him putting out the first Grade 7" as well as the classic Ottawa/Jihad split 12" (a classic in my book). I found out this info all in short order so I had to have him on the show. We go deep on Detroit hardcore, DIY worlds colliding and the world of stand up comedy. Have fun!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Jason Stewart from How Long Gone
item.itunes:title: Jason Stewart from How Long Gone
item.description:
The core is strong in this one. I have Jason Stewart, one of the co-hosts from the prolific podcast How Long Gone. He also is a DJ operating under the moniker of "Them Jeans" as well as a man in the culinary scene working with a ton of different brands. In short, he's a cool dude. What makes him even cooler is our shared history within the OC hardcore scene and the deep threads that he ties back to being exposed to the DIY music community. We discuss the OC core, Del Taco marketing and his life as a DJ. A lot of joking in this particular episode but we go places. Enjoy!


Please notice the artwork change as directly lifted from their podcast, How Long Gone.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Jaime Mason from There Were Wires
item.itunes:title: Jaime Mason from There Were Wires
item.description:
There Were Wires. Many of you probably never checked the band out when they were active and playing shows but, now is your chance to get familiar. Jaime Mason was the vocalist of the dark hardcore/punk/metal band from the Northeast (specifically the Martha's Vineyard hardcore scene...which is a hilarious thing to type) and has just recently re-released their awesome EP "Somnambulists" on the re-launched Iodine Recordings. We discuss his time in the band, working in the restaurant industry and why resurrecting the band now made sense. Enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Curtis Running Rabbit Lefthand from Wild Rose Hardcore Festival and Indegineous Resiliance in Music (IRIM)
item.itunes:title: Curtis Running Rabbit Lefthand from Wild Rose Hardcore Festival and Indegineous Resiliance in Music (IRIM)
item.description:
So stoked to talk to Curtis Running Rabbit Lefthand who is a member of the Blackfoot tribe located in and around the Calgary, Alberta area in Canada. He's one of the founders of the Wild Rose Hardcore Festival as well as working with the IRIM organization to get members of the Indiginous community with the music industry as a whole. His POV is very interesting and enlightening and as a hardcore kid, you love to see the hustle and work to highlight this important part of our scene. We discuss his introduction to heavy music, working to build a community and so much more. Dive in and learn a thing or two, I know I did.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:author: iHeartPodcasts and Ray Harkins

item.title: Jamison Isaak from Teen Daze
item.itunes:title: Jamison Isaak from Teen Daze
item.description:
As you grow older, your musical taste changes and evolves and I for one, welcome it. You don't have to listen to aggressive music all day, every day. Of course, you don't need me to tell you that but the past few years I have gotten really into dreamy soundscapes and our guest this week creates those in spades. His name is Jamison Isaak and plays under the moniker Teen Daze. I had a sneaking suspicion that he had a connection to punk/hardcore/DIY and boy, was I right. We get in deep with his life in rural Canada, the importance of Much Music, melodic hardcore and so much more. Trust me, you'll enjoy this convo even if you aren't familiar with his music.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Joe Nelson from Trust Records and Ignite
item.itunes:title: Joe Nelson from Trust Records and Ignite
item.description:
Oh boy, got a great one this week for you with the So Cal hardcore legend (my words, not his) Joe Nelson. He's the original vocalist of Ignite, road dog for bands like Quicksand, Insted and more. He also played in bands like The Killing Flame and is gearing up to release a new LP from another one of his musical projects, Triggerman. He is also responsible for launching Trust Records, which is a great re-issue label that is making sure some seminal records don't go out of print and are widely available for all. We discuss his time on the road with bands, the legacy of OC hardcore and why he chose to start this label. Dive in and enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: David Farrier, filmmaker/journalist (Dark Tourist, Tickled, Webworm)
item.itunes:title: David Farrier, filmmaker/journalist (Dark Tourist, Tickled, Webworm)
item.description:
I love David Farrier. His documentary Tickled was one of the most captivating and bizarre stories I have ever seen put to film and from then I just seemed to encounter his work across the web. Fast forward a few years later and our paths crossed when friend (and previous guest of the show, Aaron Harris from Isis) connected us over email and then, it all came together. I had to have him on the pod to discuss his love of music, connection to subcultures and film making. Listen and enjoy!

Subscribe to David's Substack!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Dylan Baldi from Cloud Nothings
item.itunes:title: Dylan Baldi from Cloud Nothings
item.description:
It's good to admit when you are wrong and I did that with Dylan on this weeks episode. I wrote off Cloud Nothings for no reason beyond my own personal misconceptions and boy, that was silly. They are a great band and I had to have Dylan Baldi, the lead singer/brainchild, from Cloud Nothings to discuss many things including life in Cleveland, libraries and evolving your sound over time. Get into it!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Mike Williams from Eyehategod
item.itunes:title: Mike Williams from Eyehategod
item.description:
Sludge metal/doom/stoner...whatever you want to call them, Eyehategod is a completely unique and incredible band which is why I was happy to throw open the podcast studio doors (aka the internet) and invite the vocalist, Mike Williams in for a chat. We discuss nihilism within the bands music, how his reputation sometimes precedes him and living for today. It's a great discussion and hope you enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Mike Reed from Small Brown Bike
item.itunes:title: Mike Reed from Small Brown Bike
item.description:
It's Small Brown Bike time! I love this band and saw them many times in the early 2000's (and Mike was actually one of the first interviews I ever did when I was writing for zines, remember those?) and fell in love with the band. They've subsequently released more amazing music and been active here and there when shows were a thing. Mike had been on my list for some time to have on the show, and we made it happen. We discuss his life in rural Michigan, being compared to Hot Water Music and following the flow (sounds mysterious, but it makes sense when you listen to the chat).

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Chase Mason from Gatecreeper
item.itunes:title: Chase Mason from Gatecreeper
item.description:
Let's get aggressive. Chase Mason is the vocalist for the punishing desert band, Gatecreeper (who just released an absolute BANGER of a record called "An Unexpected Reality") and is a great dude. We discuss him growing up in Arizona, his recovery journey through addiction and his wide ranging taste in music. Let's GOOOOO!

Listen to The PunkRock MBA Podcast

item.title: Emily Gullickson, professional gambler (horse racing)
item.itunes:title: Emily Gullickson, professional gambler (horse racing)
item.description:
A little bit left of center guest but a great one nonetheless is Emily Gullickson who has made her life by exploring her passion of horse racing and betting. I discovered her through a podcast called "Gamblers" where in she tells her story but most interestingly, speaks about her history in punk/hardcore. I reached out to her to find out more and had her come onto the show. We dove deep into a variety of topics like her putting out Spazz records, being a straight edge adult and the ethics behind horse racing. Loved this chat and I know you will too.

Listen to The Punk Rock MBA podcast!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Pete Appleby from Renee Heartfelt/Count Me Out
item.itunes:title: Pete Appleby from Renee Heartfelt/Count Me Out
item.description:
Man, do I have a treat for you. This week we have Pete Appleby who played in Count Me Out and Renee Heartfelt, both of them who were incredibly important bands to me (and many others). We dig in with Pete to discuss how both bands may have been a few years too "early", the trials and tribulations with the business side of music and his life as a dentist now. Enjoy!

Listen to the PunkRockMBA Podcast with Finn McKenty - https://podlink.to/prmbapodcast

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Dylan Slocum from Spanish Love Songs

If you haven't heard of Spanish Love Songs, you my friend...are in for a treat. Their latest LP "Brave Faces Everyone" was one of my favorites of last year and I wanted to bring Dylan (the lead vocalist/guitarist) on the show to discuss their rise in popularity in Europe, comparing the movie/music industry and being a contrarian by nature. Listen and enjoy!

item.title: Hanif Abdurraqib from Lost Notes Podcast, Poet, Writer and more
item.itunes:title: Hanif Abdurraqib from Lost Notes Podcast, Poet, Writer and more
item.description:
I am honored to have on a great human and thoughtful music critic, author, podcast host and all around wordsmith, Hanif Abdurraqib. I felt compelled to reach out to him after loving his season of the incredible music podcast, Lost Notes, as I knew he had connections to our beautiful DIY punk/hardcore scene. We dive in to his life in Columbus, remembering to be a fan of music (as a critic) and the process of writing. LETS GO!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Tim Riley from Souvenirs
item.itunes:title: Tim Riley from Souvenirs
item.description:
My friend Tim Riley from Souvenirs is on the podcast this week on the heels of the release of their newest LP called "Love For the Lack Of It", released by Other People Records. We roll up our sleeves and get into being welcoming, balancing creativity with "real life" and his battle with rheumatoid arthritis. It's quite a journey, so enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Serena Cherry from Svalbard
item.itunes:title: Serena Cherry from Svalbard
item.description:
I love the feeling of discovering new music, even when a band isn't technically "new" and Svalbard, did just that for me this year. I had to have Serena on the show, so we made it happen. Their new LP "When I Die, Will I Get Better" blew me away so Serena and I discuss that, the UK press, being an outsider and of course, roller coasters. Dive in and find out more about your new favorite band.

item.title: Jay Laughlin from Turning Point, Godspeed and Honey
item.itunes:title: Jay Laughlin from Turning Point, Godspeed and Honey
item.description:
Turning Point. What a legendary band and I had the chance to speak to Jay Laughlin, who played guitar in the band as well as Godspeed (highly overlooked post-Turning Point emo band) and his current band, Honey (a rad metal band). We discuss how he views his musical legacy, how much it cost them to record "It's Always Darkest Before the Dawn" and being creative at all costs. Jay is a lifer and I am sure glad he's put out all of the music he has.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:author: iHeartPodcasts and Ray Harkins

item.title: Andy Franchere from Diehard Youth and Ill Communication
item.itunes:title: Andy Franchere from Diehard Youth and Ill Communication
item.description:
Supporting your local scene is an important thing for ANY type of music, especially DIY punk/hardcore. Andy Franchere is an embodiment of that. He sang for the band Diehard Youth and currently plays in Ill Communication but more importantly, he is instrumental in encouraging his local scene. Andy's story may sound familiar because you most likely know someone like him, which is why I am glad to feature this discussion with him. We discuss his life as a firefighter, growing a scene and knowing your limits. Even though you may not know his bands, Andy's story will ring true to many of you.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Aaron Marshall from Intervals
item.itunes:title: Aaron Marshall from Intervals
item.description:
As he makes his podcast rounds, Aaron Marshall from Intervals stops by the show to talk about how the heck an instrumental metal band got so popular. We discuss in depth his decision to release his own records and maintain control, slow growth and the idea of turning his passion for music into an actual career. It's a deep dive into the business side of things but also an insightful look at the creative process. Enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Joe Taylor from Knuckle Puck
item.description:
Pop punk is alive and well! Joe Taylor is the lead vocalist for Knuckle Puck and I am glad to have him on the show this week. We discuss having to grow up fast, being practical and doing your best to avoid cliches. He was honest and revealing, which is frankly what I want out of these conversations so...MISSION ACCOMPLISHED.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Chris Demakes from Less Than Jake
item.itunes:title: Chris Demakes from Less Than Jake
item.description:
I think this may be one of the first "ska" bands I have had on the show, but let's be honest...Less Than Jake is more than that. Chris Demakes is a great dude and this discussion about his band was very revealing. We were able to discuss punk rock guilt, navigating the highs and lows of a long music career and of course, we talk about Tony Hawk Pro Skater. Let's go!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Jeff Mielcarz from Die My Will
item.itunes:title: Jeff Mielcarz from Die My Will
item.description:
This episode was a fun one for me and VERY self serving as I absolutely love this band called Die My Will. The band is very much a "undiscovered gem" and frankly, they weren't that prolific or long lasting but always stuck in my head. Jeff played drums in the band and we get to nerd out about the band and their place within the metal core world and playing 17 minute sets. Enjoy and hopefully you will find one of your new favorite bands.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

Immediately after we started talking I felt a kinship with him and I hope you feel the same way. Enjoy!

item.title: Joseph Rowland from Pallbearer
item.itunes:title: Joseph Rowland from Pallbearer
item.description:
This chat has been a long time in the making as I first fell in love with Pallbearer back in 2012 when they dropped their STAGGERING debut LP, "Sorrow and Extinction" and then followed all of their subsequent releases. I had to bring Joseph on the show because not only do I love the band, but think that more people need to pay attention to what they are doing. Joseph and I speak about his experience being raised in an alternative religion, the Little Rock scene and ambition amongst many other things. Enjoy!

Visit Rockabilia and use the code PC100WORDS for 15% off of your order.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Danielle Parsons, photographer
item.itunes:title: Danielle Parsons, photographer
item.description:
This week we have photographer extraordinaire Danielle Parsons on the show. I can guarantee that you have seen her photos in the past but maybe didn't make the connection. She's incredibly prolific and has an incredible eye for capturing compelling visuals. We discussed her life in Pennsylvania, imposter syndrome and how she won a contest to have her photo published on a Jones Soda bottle at age 13. item.itunes:title: Rob Fish from Every Scar Has A Story, Resurrection and 108
item.description:
I have the pleasure of welcoming on an incredibly influential vocalist within our scene, Rob Fish. He sang for bands like 108, Resurrection, The Judas Factor and more recently, Every Scar Has a Story. It's a blistering EP that everyone should check out immediately. Rob has been incredibly open throughout his musical life so turning over some new leaves is what I tried to focus on and we spoke of trauma, figuring out what to do with your life and intensity. Enjoy!

Nate Rebolledo from Xibalba is on the podcast today! We tried to make this happen a few years ago, but now...it's all happening. Nate and I discuss his life as a firefighter (he is no longer), serving his community through hardcore and finally, his career in live production/touring. It was a compelling discussion that I of course, urge you to check out.

item.title: Brian McTernan from Battery/Be Well and a producer
item.itunes:title: Brian McTernan from Battery/Be Well and a producer
item.description:
I know it may seem like I said this a lot, but this episode is a huge one for me. Brian McTernan is the vocalist from Battery, guitarist from Ashes and more recently, Be Well and his art has definitely impacted me in a deep way. He's also an incredibly prolific producer as well helping bands like Texas Is The Reason, Bane, Thrice and many more create some of their most important records. We go LONG with so many things like depression, touring Europe and being the "it" producer and the pressure that comes with it. This conversation went so incredibly well and I am proud to share it with you. Listen and enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Corey Coffman from Gleemer

I had to have Corey Coffman from the band on the podcast to pick his brain and find out more about life in Colorado, recording bands and the process of making music. It's metaphysical, it's fun and above all...a great new band you need to check out. Thanks for listening!

item.itunes:title: Independent Venues Are At Risk - Discussion w/ Stephen Chilton from Save Our Stages
item.description:

I had my friend Stephen Chilton from Phoenix, Arizona who has been booking shows for many years and is part of the National Independent Venue Association. We discuss their campaign called #SaveOurStages and what he's learned through his years of promoting shows.

Please visit Saveourstages.com

item.title: Riley Gale from Power Trip
item.itunes:title: Riley Gale from Power Trip
item.description:
Happy Quarantining wherever you may be! Hopefully you are staying healthy, safe and inside. Please welcome Riley Gale to the show this week, who is the vocalist for the almighty Power Trip. We discuss his relationship with touring, the music business (and his complicated feelings on it) as well as competition between bands. As usual, it's a wide ranging conversation that I am glad we contained. Enjoy and support all of the touring bands that have recently had to cancel their upcoming tour dates for the foreseeable future. Our music community is reeling and we need to help where we can.  Visit Rockabilia and use the code PC100WORDS for 15% off of your order. The best place for all of your VIP experiences at shows is with Soundrink.

item.title: Andy Othling from Lowercase Noises (live from NAMM w/ Gator Cases)
item.itunes:title: Andy Othling from Lowercase Noises (live from NAMM w/ Gator Cases)
item.description:
I had a great experience recording my first "live" podcast at the NAMM Conference back in January of 2020 with my good friend Andy Othling from Lowercase Noises at the Gator Cases booth. We get in deep with his struggles and bond over anxiety, depression and how that has affected the creation of his music and more. This conversation made me feel less alone and I hope it has the same affect on you. Thanks for listening! Gator Cases has a ton of great podcasting equipment, check it out! Ryan Patterson is a lifer. He currently plays in the incredible Fotocrime and has put time in other genera pushing bands like Coliseum and The National Acrobat. item.title: Travis Tabron, ex-Varials & Ethan Harrison from Great American Ghost
item.itunes:title: Travis Tabron, ex-Varials & Ethan Harrison from Great American Ghost
item.description:
We have a double header of modern metalcore for you today! First up, we have Ethan from Great American Ghost discussing keeping his band together and balancing real life/tour life. Then, I have Travis Tabron who used to sing for the band Varials. We recorded this before he left the band and in this chat, you can hear a little bit of his thought process behind him leaving the band (without me even knowing it!). We also discuss the Philly hardcore scene and why recording vocals is a really terrible experience. Enjoy! Visit Rockabilia and use the code PC100WORDS for 15% off of your order. item.itunes:title: Aaron Gillespie from The Almost/Underoath
item.description:
We have TWO great conversations for the price of one today. First up, we have Franke Blydenburgh from Rockabilia discussing with me the merch world, how bootlegs work and the changing ecosystem of that side of the business. INCREDIBLY fascinating stuff. Then, Aaron Gillespie from The Almost/Underoath jumps on the line and we get in DEEP with aesthetics, not being a "cool band" and anxiety. item.title: Jon Tuttle from Codeseven
item.itunes:title: Jon Tuttle from Codeseven
item.description:
What an episode and what a band! Jon Tuttle from Codeseven continues our march down North Carolina's storied punk/hardcore past with a very interesting discussion on how they almost signed with Earache Records, being a "bands band" and how he played in a band with not one, but both of his brothers. Do yourself a favor and dive into this episode, you won't be bummed. PC100WORDS is the code for 15% off your order via our pals at Rockabilia. All officially licensed and the highest quality band merch you can shake a stick at. Bridge Nine Records is proud to present Spiral Heads. A killer 7" from members of MGMT, Doomriders and American Nightmare. It's like an early 80's SST band. Check it out. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Tommy Rogers from Between the Buried and Me
item.itunes:title: Tommy Rogers from Between the Buried and Me
item.description:
Welcome to the month of North Carolina! We are taking a long look at this incredible punk/hardcore/indie scene by interviewing some of the people who have helped build it up. This week is my friend Tommy Rogers from Between the Buried and Me making a RETURN appearance on the show. We get into a ton of different things including what it means to be a "working class" band, being a fan boy and being open to change. I love him and I love this discussion. Enjoy! This episode is brought to you by Bridge Nine Records and their two new pre-orders from Agonstic Front. Check them out! 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Shane Durgee from Framework and Earth Crisis
item.itunes:title: Shane Durgee from Framework and Earth Crisis
item.description:
We have on the show this week, Shane Durgee who was the vocalist for the pre-Earth Crisis band called Framework. Often overlooked in the lore of Syracuse hardcore, I wanted to have Shane on to discuss what the early days of that scene was like. The episode also serves as a compendium to a previous episode that we did a few weeks ago with Scott Crouse from Earth Crisis about each of their full lengths. Shane and I get in depth with some fun EC stories and more. Listen and enjoy! 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Scott Crouse from Earth Crisis
item.itunes:title: Scott Crouse from Earth Crisis
item.description:
A bit of a different format this week but one that I think you will enjoy. I took a look at every full-length in Earth Crisis' catalog, brought the guitarist Scott Crouse onto the podcast and took a deep dive into the mentality of where the band was at, their process and other fun stories that surrounded each of the LP's. The result is what you hear and honestly, blew my mind. So many incredible stories and anecdotes were shared that even the super fan of Earth Crisis will have no idea about. I call it a "Self Audit" and I hope to do this more. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: George Pettit from Alexisonfire
item.itunes:title: George Pettit from Alexisonfire
item.description:
We have a two for the price of one podcast today! For the "main" part of the podcast, I have my old friend George Pettit on the show today. He's the vocalist for the now active Alexisonfire. We hopped on the phone one day (some dodgy cell service up in Canada) and discussed his life as a firefighter, being a reluctant frontman and the importance of obsession. Before that discussion, I have Dan Thomson from Sparrows on. They are a great hardcore band that deserves your attention. Enjoy the supersized episode! 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Trish Chisholm from The End of the Ocean
item.itunes:title: Trish Chisholm from The End of the Ocean
item.description:
Post-rock. Just the name of this genere of music is soothing and I for one, love it. Trish plays in a band called The End of the Ocean that just recently released an extremely compelling LP and I had to have her on. We discuss the concept of playlisting (it's an extremely interesting and influential aspect of the music industry that doesn't get discussed very much), sexual identity and more. Trust me, even if you aren't familiar with the band you will like this discussion.

item.description:
Episode 343 - Another entry in our month long focus of the Seattle music scene and this week, it's Ian Shelton from Regional Justice Center and Seattle's New Gods. We discuss creative drive, the divided music scenes he experienced and another huge passion of his, filmmaking. I loved the perspective and experience he shared in our conversation, so check it out and enjoy! 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Dann Gallucci from Murder City Devils/Modest Mouse
item.itunes:title: Dann Gallucci from Murder City Devils/Modest Mouse
item.description:
SEATTLE MONTH! All during the month of March we take a deeper look at the Seattle punk/hardcore/indie scene from the people who have helped create it! Dann Gallucci was a gem of a person and a great conversation. He played guitar in Murder City Devils, Modest Mouse, Cold War Kids, Area 51, Death Wish Kids and more! He also creates incredible podcasts with his production company called Little Everywhere. A compelling conversation about the Seattle scene, different levels of "success" and fatherhood. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:
Episode 340 - It's that time where Joey, Jeremy and I travel back in time to re-visit our best of 2006 list and see if it holds up. It's a fun time and hope you re-discover some records or find out about them in the first place! Ray Harkins Underoath - Define The Great Line Mogwai-Mr. Beast Khoma-The Second Wave Isis-In The Absence Of Truth Fucked Up- Hidden World Agollach-Ashes Against The Grain Cult Of Luna-Somewhere Along The Highway Norma Jean-Redeemer Pelican-The Fire In Our Throats Will Beckon The Thaw Saosin-S/T Joey Cahill 1. NoFX - Wolves in Wolves Clothing Jeremy Bolm Converge - No Heroes  Mewithoutyou - Brother, Sister POS - Audition  The Bronx - II Kevin Devine - Put Your Ghost To Rest  Belle & Sebastian - The Life Pursuit  Tragedy - Nerve Damage  Envy - Insomniac Doze  Jenny Lewis & The Watson Twins - Rabbit Fur Coat Thursday - City By The Light Divided

item.title: Fantasy Band Draft w/ Dave Defeo and Justin Smith (Graf Orlock)
item.itunes:title: Fantasy Band Draft w/ Dave Defeo and Justin Smith (Graf Orlock)
item.description:
We have an incredibly fun episode today in which two of my close friends, Dave Defeo and Justin Smith (Graf Orlock) discuss our draft picks for putting together the best band we could within the punk/hardcore ecosystem. Listen to our reasoning for these picks and listen to the incredible band names that get revealed later in the episode. Ray Harkins Vocalist - Tim Singer from Deadguy/Kiss It Goodbye   Lead Guitar - Chris Hannah from Propagandhi  Rhythm Guitar - Jay Palumbo from Elliott  Bassist - Sergio Vega from Quicksand/Deftones  Drummer - Dave Whitte from Discordance Axis, Municipal Waste, Burnt By The Sun  Utility Player - Yannick Lorrain from His Hero Is Gone/Tragedy and Union of Uranus  Justin Smith from Graf Orlock  Guitar: Adam Nathanson from Born Against Guitar/vox: Todd Burdette from His Hero Is Gone/Tragedy Vox: Chris Colohan from Cursed/Left for Dead Drums: Bill Stevenson from Descendents  Bass: Chuck Dukowski from Black Flag Utility: Brian Baker from Minor Threat Dave Def Vox: Brendan Murphy - Counterparts/END Guitar: Michael Schleibaum - Darkest Hour Guitar: Todd Jones - Nails Bass: Craig Setari - Sick Of It All Drums: Justin Graves - A Life Once Lost Utility: B. Scot Rousse - Jud Jud

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Jeremy Stith from Fury/Gem
item.description:
Episode 331 - You like hardcore right? You should and you should also love this band from my backyard called Fury. The vocalist Jeremy Stith comes on the podcast today to wrap about a ton of things including a subject that I bring up about how terrible 7 inches are. More importantly we also discuss soccer, his metal core roots and the importance of expression. It’s a wide ranging and reflective conversation we had on a Saturday morning so pull up a chair and enjoy. Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands.

Episode 327 - My new friend Luis Aponte from Jesus Piece is on the show today. Jesus Piece are an incredible hardcore band from Philadelphia that you must check out. We discuss his life in and around Philadelphia, Krishna consciousness and using visual influences to affect art. It’s a really great chat and I urge you to check out.  Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands. Download the app, Yousician, today and start learning how to play guitar, piano and other instruments immediately!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Ben Nichols from Lucero
item.itunes:title: Ben Nichols from Lucero
item.description:
Episode 326 - This is a big one for me, Ben Nichols from Lucero comes on the show today to talk about the DIY scene in Little Rock, AR (where he grew up), making adult like decisions and owning your own business. We also discuss his contributions to his brothers films (Mud, Take Shelter, Midnight Special etc…) and how the band has been able to remain relevant for as long as they have. I loved, loved, LOVED this discussion and I know you will as well. Enjoy!  Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands. Download the app, Yousician, today and start learning how to play guitar, piano and other instruments immediately!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: BE SPECIFIC: Episode 5 - MAILBAG SPECIAL
item.itunes:title: BE SPECIFIC: Episode 5 - MAILBAG SPECIAL
item.description:
BE SPECIFIC - EPISODE 5: Mailbag Special! I answer your questions about all things related to the music industry as asked by YOU, the listener. I got a lot of rad questions and was able to get deep on a lot of different subjects and offer advice for bands asking if they need a manager to the conflict of separating art vs the artist and SO much more. Hope you enjoy! Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands.

item.title: BE SPECIFIC: Episode 4 - Finn McKenty on Media Sponsorships and how they work
item.itunes:title: BE SPECIFIC: Episode 4 - Finn McKenty on Media Sponsorships and how they work
item.description:
BE SPECIFIC - EPISODE 4: Media partnerships? How the hell do they work? My good friend Finn McKenty who is head of marketing at URM Academy and runs the great YouTube channel called PunkRockMBA dives deep with me on this. He speaks specifically about his work with Alternative Press while he was at a company called Creative Live and worked with their award show. We get super nerdy but I hope you enjoy!  Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands. item.title: BE SPECIFIC: Episode 3 - Shawn Carrano from Headphone Management
item.itunes:title: BE SPECIFIC: Episode 3 - Shawn Carrano from Headphone Management
item.description:
BE SPECIFIC - EPISODE 3: Shawn Carrano from Headphone Management joins me today as we get in depth with what it’s like to grow a band from local act, to a nationally recognized touring band. The steps in which most bands and managers have to take in the first few years have always been incredibly interesting to me as I have lived through it and have attempted to help bands through it. Shawn has done the same to a much higher degree and he walks us through that process.  Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: BE SPECIFIC - EPISODE 2: Wayne Pighini from Fly South Management on Rammstein's rise
item.itunes:title: BE SPECIFIC - EPISODE 2: Wayne Pighini from Fly South Management on Rammstein's rise
item.description:
BE SPECIFIC - EPISODE 2: Wayne Pighini from Fly South Management on Rammstein’s meteoric rise to become one of the biggest bands in the world. Wayne is a close friend and he worked hand in hand with a band at the label that initially exposed them here in the US. Very few of us have a front row seat when a band is exploding and Wayne walks us through a lot of the intricacies of what he was doing at the label. Tons of rad details in this chat and you will undoubtedly enjoy. Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: BE SPECIFIC - EPISODE 1 - Shane Told from Silverstein
item.description:
BE SPECIFIC - EPISODE 1: Shane Told from Silverstein hops on the show to discuss the business of being in a band and tells stories about how he lost a briefcase of cash, the intricacies of touring and ultimately, did Silverstein ever sell more merch than the Deftones? This series is all about shedding a light on things that people are sometimes afraid to talk about and ultimately, to be specific. item.title: Paul Shirley, former NBA player and writer
item.itunes:title: Paul Shirley, former NBA player and writer
item.description:
Episode 325 - Do you know what it’s like to play in the NBA? My guest this week Paul Shirley does. He’s a professional writer and podcaster these days but is also, a huge music fan! I sat down with him at his apartment to discuss music as therapy/comfort, what you process when you are going through an identity crisis and annoying trends in music. Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy.

item.title: Donovan Melero from Hail The Sun
item.itunes:title: Donovan Melero from Hail The Sun
item.description:
Episode 324 - A drummer, that sings! What a shock! I am being sarcastic but Donovan Melero is on the show today. He plays in a post-hardcore band called Hail the Sun who is quite the anomaly in their slow but gradual growth and Donovan has a very compelling back story. We discuss his multicultural upbringing, his battles with addiction and the very act of singing and drumming without verging into horrible stereotypical questions. Dive in! Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands. Let me buy you dinner with Green Chef! Incredible food delivered right to your door. Get $50 off your first box with the code WORDS now! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Misha Mansoor from Periphery and 3Dot Recordings
item.itunes:title: Misha Mansoor from Periphery and 3Dot Recordings
item.description:
Episode 323 - We have a great episode in store for you today in the form of Misha Mansoor from Periphery and 4 Seconds Ago. He also recently started a record label called 3Dot Recordings that will be releasing some pretty cool stuff. We get in depth with being technical for technical sake, what it means to be a gear head and the realities of the music industry. It’s a very comprehensive look at all things about making a living as a musician and more. Dive into YouTube Music and their new app, it’s the BEST place to stream all of your favorite music and discovering your new favorite bands. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! item.title: Aaron Harris from Isis (the band) and Palms
item.itunes:title: Aaron Harris from Isis (the band) and Palms
item.description:
Episode 322 - Oh my, this is a big one for me. Aaron Harris, who is the drummer of one of my favorite bands of all time, Isis, is on the show today. I went over to his home studio and we rapped about his formative years in playing drums, difficult decisions that Isis had to make over the years in regards to tours/business and his life after Isis in scoring/composing for films and other visual arts. It’s a wide ranging discussion that reveals a lot of info even a super dork like me didn’t know. Pull up a chair and enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Leander Gloversmith from KMGMT Management
item.itunes:title: Leander Gloversmith from KMGMT Management
item.description:
Episode 321 - Hello everyone! I have a treat of an episode today for those who are looking to work in the music industry! My good friend Leander Gloversmith works at KMGMT taking care of bands like Neck Deep and As It Is but also has a long history in PR as well as playing in bands himself. He has a very interesting career and one that I think many of you can learn from. Not to mention, he’s an incredibly great human to boot. Listen and learn! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy.

item.title: Lauren Kashan from Sharptooth
item.itunes:title: Lauren Kashan from Sharptooth
item.description:
Episode 320 - STRAP IN, this episode is quite a journey. I have Lauren Kashan, the vocalist from hardcore band Sharptooth, on the show today. What starts off as a conversation getting to know her, takes a very dark turn and she discusses her substance abuse issues and her admission into a “rehab clinic” that essential, acts like a cult. It’s an incredibly powerful story and one that I was really appreciative for her sharing here. You must listen to this week, no joke it’s one of my favorite chats I have done to date. Reply All “Pain Funnel” Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Sunny Singh from HateFiveSix
item.itunes:title: Sunny Singh from HateFiveSix
item.description:
Episode 319 - Today was an episode long coming, I have the man/myth/legend Sunny Singh from HateFiveSix on the show today! He’s responsible for documenting MANY bands via his website HateFiveSix and all around the internet. Essentially, he’s an archivist for all of your favorite punk/hardcore/metal bands. We discuss trolling, his passion for documenting bands and living in between two worlds. It’s a real insightful conversation that I am stoked to share. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

Mike had always lingered in my life in music and he has led a very interesting life dedicating himself to his craft in the arts. item.description:
METALCORE! This episode was an incredibly fun romp through the beautiful pastures of 90’s and 2000’s metal core but not your “typical” bands that you may think of. I had my friend Josh Robbins from the band Late Bloomer on the show to discuss 8 records that need your attention. Find your new favorite record in this list and enjoy! RAY Torn Apart “Nothing Is Permanent” Focal Point “Suffering of the Masses” Excessive Force “In Your Blood” Curl Up and Die “Unfortunately We Are Not Robots” JOSH Burnt By the Sun “Perfect is the Enemy of the Good” Premonitions of War “Left in Kowloon” A Perfect Murder “Cease to Suffer” Martyr AD “On Earth As It Is in Hell” Mack Weldon is the most comfortable clothing I’ve worn, period. item.title: Yvette Young from Covet
item.itunes:title: Yvette Young from Covet
item.description:
Episode 315 - If you like technical math rock (like I do) this week will be your jam! I have Yvette Young from Covet on the show. If you haven’t heard of her band, that’s totally fine as they JUST released their debut EP on Triple Crown Records (and it’s really good). She’s an incredibly compelling guest and we discuss tons of stuff like competition, building communities and the word “hella” in the Northern California eco-system. In all seriousness, we discuss some pretty important things and I’d love for you to come listen. Mack Weldon is the most comfortable clothing I’ve worn, period. Get $20 off by using the code WORDS. WeTransfer is the only way you should ever send large files, for free. The best, plain and simple. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! item.title: Matt Coplon from Reversal Of Man
item.itunes:title: Matt Coplon from Reversal Of Man
item.description:
Episode 314 - Please welcome my new friend, Matt Coplon to the show today. He’s the vocalist from “screamo” (the original description) heroes Reversal of Man and a professional BMX rider. I have wanted him on the show for quite some time and was excited that we finally made it happen. We talk about BMX riding (and if it is still considered lame by skate culture), poetry and unsustainable touring. It’s a glorious chat and you must listen! WeTransfer is the only way you should ever send large files, for free. The best, plain and simple. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! item.itunes:title: Neeraj Kane from Hope Conspiracy, Suicide File, Hesitation Wounds, Beginners
item.description:
Episode 313 - HAPPY 4th of July! Talk about a dude who’s played in some great bands, my friend Neeraj Kane joins us today on the pod. He’s played in The Hope Conspiracy, Suicide File, Hesitation Wounds and much more. We talk in depth about his life in the Chicago suburbs, being politically active and engaged as well as the notion of playing in a “full time” band. Enjoy! item.title: Jason Gleason from Further Seems Forever/Action Reaction
item.itunes:title: Jason Gleason from Further Seems Forever/Action Reaction
item.description:
FURTHER SEEMS FOREVER. I am happy to welcome my old friend, Jason Gleason on the show. He sang on the incredible FSF record, “How To Start A Fire” and was able to convince him to come on the show. The reason I say convince is that Jason hasn’t had the best experiences with press, but fortunately this was a walk in the park. We discuss his upbringing in Minneapolis, his time in Further Seems Forever and public vs private life. I really dug this chat so, DIG IN! Sound of Vinyl is the best record store you haven’t visited yet. Sign up for their text service and get $5 off your first record. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! item.title: Michael Grodner, director of The Icarus Line Must Die
item.itunes:title: Michael Grodner, director of The Icarus Line Must Die
item.description:
Episode 311 - Film and music. The two have been passions of mine and the guest this week for quite some time and I was excited to talk about it with the director, Michael Grodner. He most recently finished his first feature length film called The Icarus Line Must Die which is an incredible piece of work combining the LA punk scene and a film noir look at life in a band. He also directed many music videos that you have probably seen from bands like Planes Mistaken For Stars, Brazil and more. It’s a fascinating discussion of creating art in 2018 and beyond. Dive in and enjoy! Sound of Vinyl is the best record store you haven’t visited yet. Sign up for their text service and get $5 off your first record. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
It’s podcast on podcast love, but of course our guest this week has a long history with independent music. Jake Brennan, who is the host of the incredible True Crime/Music podcast called Disgraceland and vocalist for Cast Iron Hike, is on the show this week. item.title: Lisa Garelick from Equal Vision Records
item.itunes:title: Lisa Garelick from Equal Vision Records
item.description:
Label talk! I have my good friend Lisa Garelick who works at Equal Vision Records as a project manager on the show this week. She has a ton of experience in all the comings and goings in the music industry from management, booking, PR and more. We have a in depth chat about street punk, some behind the scenes music industry talk and how hustle plays an important role in her development. Enjoy this pleasant chat! Let me buy you dinner and get $30 off your first order with Hello Fresh. I love their meals and you will too. Use promo code WORDS30. item.title: Mom and Son
item.itunes:title: Mom and Son
item.description:
Happy pending Mother’s Day. I thought it would be interesting to speak in depth to my Mom who has had some cool musical experiences in the past as well as getting her take on what her thoughts were of her son, getting into weird independent music. I also thought it’d be interesting to speak to my 7 year old son and his passion for music. I think it’s a very interesting juxtaposition of how, generationally speaking, music has played a part in different people’s lives. Dive in and hear some crazy stories of The Beatles, Elvis and more! Get THE BEST coffee with Bones Coffee and use the code 100WORDS for 20% off your entire order. This stuff is THE BEST. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy.

item.title: BONUS EPISODE - On Tour with Taken
item.itunes:title: BONUS EPISODE - On Tour with Taken
item.description:
BONUS EPISODE - Want to go on tour? Well, that’s hard for ALL of you to fit in the van but I wanted to bring you this chat that I had with the rest of the guys in my band, Taken while we were on the road in December in Canada. We are releasing a new EP next week on Other People Records and while this is a little self-promotional of me, I think it was a very insightful chat with my friends about why music is important, what it means to stay involved in independent music and other memories. Dive in and join us on tour! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show! Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy.
