item.description:
Episode 300 - LET’S PARTY! I can’t believe it’s been 300 episodes but here we are and thank you very much for listening and continuing to support this project. We have Chris Taylor hopping on the show this week. He is the vocalist for recently reunited and original “screamo” legends Page 99 (or otherwise known as Pg. 99). We dive deep into the intricacies of navigating the reunion show world, empathy and being intentionally unconventional. It’s a long one so settle in and enjoy the nuggets of wisdom that are contained within. Transfer files the right way, with WeTransfer The best way to take care of yourself is with HIMS. item.itunes:title: Tony Rettman, author of Straight Edge and NYHC
item.description:
Episode 284 - Books! I love them and especially when they are about things I love, like hardcore! Tony Rettman is the author of two incredible books entitled NYHC and Straight Edge. We discuss writing as a profession, the process of making a book and the importance of context. A really interesting dive into the literary world and how it collides with our independent subculture. item.title: Chaka Malik from Burn
item.itunes:title: Chaka Malik from Burn
item.description:
Episode 276 - We are back! Hope you had a nice week off from the show. This week we have Chaka Malik from Burn/Orange 9mm and Ghost Decibels. Listen and enjoy! I love movies and Mubi is the best streaming site I have ever seen. item.title: Buried Treasure: early 2000’s Hardcore w/ Joey Cahill
item.itunes:title: Buried Treasure: early 2000’s Hardcore w/ Joey Cahill
item.description:
Episode 275 - Special Episode alert! I wanted to throw some different types of shows in the feed and I love me some Buried Treasure discussions with trusted friends. This week I bring on one of my best friends, Joey Cahill from 6131 Records to discuss early 2000’s hardcore. We focused on bands that could be loosely defined as “traditional” hardcore and not specifically metal core that was so pervasive at that time. Listen in and hopefully you will find a gem or two that you haven’t listened to for awhile or even know about in the first place! Use the code WORDS for 50% off an incredible smile with Smile Direct Club!Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Sierra Kusterbeck from Neaux and Versa Emerge
item.itunes:title: Sierra Kusterbeck from Neaux and Versa Emerge
item.description:
Episode 272 - Happy Wednesday! This week we have an engaging conversation on the rise, fall and rise story with Sierra Kusterbeck from Neaux and Versa Emerge. She rose to prominence as the singer of pop/rock band Versa Emerge in the early 2000’s at an early age, but ran into a wall and has now taken a more nuanced view of creativity and playing music in her band Neaux. It’s a really eye-opening episode that I hope you dive deep into! Pre-order the Neaux record called “Chain Up The Sun” from our buds at The Native Sound!Visit our friends over at No Echo for great features on punk, hardcore and all things heavy. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.itunes:title: Roger Miret from Agnostic Front
item.description:
Episode 271 - An absolute banger of an episode today with the man, Roger Miret. He’s the vocalist for NYC hardcore stalwarts, Agnostic Front and recently an author! His new book is out next week and we got to chat with him about Dad life, what it’s like to write a book and being in prison. For a guy that’s done a million interviews over his life, he was incredibly open and honest about all aspects of his life. A real treat! item.description:
Let’s do this! I get really philosophical with this weeks guest, Jake Smelley, the drummer for Christian hardcore band Gideon. We talk about the S Town podcast for a bit as he was raised in that particular town, what it’s like to be on the hustle for 10+ years and a deep dive into faith and one’s ability to question their beliefs. Be safe out there everyone.Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.itunes:title: Dave Lombardo from Slayer, Dead Cross, Suicidal Tendencies and The Misfits
item.description:
Episode 265 - A true gentleman is on the show this week in the form of an incredible drummer, Dave Lombardo. He plays in Slayer, Suicidal Tendencies, Dead Cross and The Misfits. Needless to say, this dude has done a million interviews but he was more than willing to go down roads that he hadn’t before and we got in depth about playing in high pressure situations, being a dad and finding stillness. It’s a great look inside of the mind of a person who shows up to work every day behind his drum kit. item.title: Al Brown from Dangers
item.itunes:title: Al Brown from Dangers
item.description:
Episode 263 - Happy pre-Fourth of July for those US listeners. My guest this week is the vocalist from punk provocateurs Dangers, Al Brown. He’s also the man responsible for an amazing festival in the early 2000’s called Sink With Cali. We dove headfirst into teaching, the in’s and out’s of running a music festival and speaking your mind. It’s a really interesting insight to a person in the middle of people having strong opinions about who he is as a person. I loved the chat and hope you will to. The best suitcase you will EVER own. Our friends at Away want to give you $20 off your purchase. Try it for 100 days and if you don’t like it, they will give you a full refund.Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Chris Colohan from Sect and Vegan Magic
item.itunes:title: Chris Colohan from Sect and Vegan Magic
item.description:
Episode 260 - We did it. 5 years of shows. I can’t believe it but thank you for joining along in this fun experiment in audio! Our guest this week is a repeat but one of my favorite vocalists of all time, Chris Colohan. He sings in the band Sect and owns the incredible company, Vegan Magic. He previously sang for the bands Cursed, Left For Dead, Burning Love, Countdown to Oblivion and more. He’s basically the realest of the real dudes you can ever meet. It had been a few years since our last chat, so I decided to celebrate and have him on the show. We get deep on what it’s like to run a business, the Southern Ontario hardcore scene and principles. HAPPY ANNIVERSARY! Step your wardrobe up by getting AMAZING clothes, underwear and more with Mack Weldon. Real talk, the best in the game. Get 20% off by using the code WORDS at checkout.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Bryan Garris from Knocked Loose
item.description:
Episode 258 - Oh boy, this episode is a doozy! We have Bryan Garris from Knocked Loose on the show, who is the vocalist of the much discussed hardcore band. It’s a deep conversation about Louisville music, popularity and education and the importance of it. Many people have an opinion on this band, let this conversation guide you and give more context for where these young upstarts are coming from! Pre-Order the new Conveyer entitled NO FUTURE today!Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.title: Aaron Lammer from Longform Podcast and Stoner
item.itunes:title: Aaron Lammer from Longform Podcast and Stoner
item.description:
Episode 257 - This is another one of my favorite type of guests, what I affectionately refer to as a “secret punk”. Aaron Lammer hosts the incredible podcasts Longform and Stoner as well as a contributing member of Francis & The Lights and we go deep into music listening habits, journalism and weed (which is a subject that I have no existing knowledge of but am really interested in the subculture). I loved this chat and hope you do as well. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Rachel Rosen from Most Precious Blood/Indecision
item.itunes:title: Rachel Rosen from Most Precious Blood/Indecision
item.description:
Happy Wednesday! On the show today is the guitarist from awesome hardcore bands Indecision, Most Precious Blood and The Wage of Sin, Rachel Rosen! I went over to her house one evening to discuss her involvement in all of those bands, her early life dealing with tragedy and the medical field. You also get the added bonus of hanging out with her dogs on microphone as well. This conversation is part of our ongoing focus of women in independent music which will come to a close next week, but until then ENJOY! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

Episode 251 - Happy April! This month I am focusing on rad women who are involved with independent music and shaping our culture for the positive with their creative focus. item.itunes:title: Chris Enriquez from On The Might of Princes
item.description:
On The Might of Princes was an incredible band. Chris Enriquez played drums in that band. So, logic would dictate that I should speak to him and guess what, I DID! We get in real deep with his upbringing in Long Island, being bullied and we get to the bottom of the band signing to Drive Thru Records…or did they? Do the damn thing and listen up to this rad, wide-ranging interview. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.itunes:title: Tom May from The Menzingers
item.description:
Episode 248 - Every week it blows my mind you all keep listening, but thank you. We have a great chat today with Tom May, the guitarist/vocalist from Scranton, PA’s punk hero’s, The Menzingers. We dive into his life in the suburbs, his early touring life and preconceived notions about the differences between the punk and hardcore scene. Their new LP, “After The Party” is one of my favorites of this year and it deserves your attention. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.title: Kevin Jordan from This Wild Life
item.itunes:title: Kevin Jordan from This Wild Life
item.description:
Yahoo! Kevin Jordan from This Wild Life is hanging out with us today. We turn over every rock and speak about how the band got hooked up with Epitaph Records, this being his “last” chance to make it in music, intimacy at shows and the secret behind being in a band (spoiler alert: hustle). Frankly, this was a nice and relaxing chat that I didn’t expect to have with Kevin but I am sure glad I did. Enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Jack Grisham from TSOL and The Joykiller
item.itunes:title: Jack Grisham from TSOL and The Joykiller
item.description:
Better late than never! One of my musical heroes, Jack Grisham is on the show today. He’s the vocalist for legendary punk provocateurs, TSOL, as well as one of Epiptah’s most underrated bands, The Joykiller. We hung out in his haunted house (for real!) and we discussed his life in and out of punk, how he remains engaged and never growing tired of finding new avenues of self-expression. We go deep into all areas of his life so strap in and enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Blasko from Ozzy Osbourne/Mercenary Management
item.itunes:title: Blasko from Ozzy Osbourne/Mercenary Management
item.description:
Episode 244 - As strange as it is to say it, it’s equally as strange for me to type it but Blasko the bass player of Ozzy Osbourne is on the show today. He’s a good friend of mine from us working together when I was at Century Media Records. He also manages a ton of bands including Black Veil Brides and hosts his own podcast called MANAGEMETAL that I urge you to check out. In any event, we discuss surreal “rock” moments, playing as a hired fun and determination. He’s got a great attitude and I loved having this discussion. Enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Carley Coma from Candiria
item.itunes:title: Carley Coma from Candiria
item.description:
Episode 243 - This guest has been on my “to speak to” list for quite some time and finally, I got him. Carley Coma the vocalist from hardcore/metal/jazz band, Candiria hung out with me over Skype and we really got into it. We spoke about living and growing up in New York City (the REAL city), his bands horrific van accident and diverse musical influences. He’s an incredibly compelling individual and I hope you enjoy it as much as I did! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.title: Stephen Cobucci from Wolves at the Gate
item.itunes:title: Stephen Cobucci from Wolves at the Gate
item.description:
Each day is one day closer to the end of our 45th president. Fortunately, we have a great discussion with Stephen Cobucci from Wolves at the Gate on the podcast today. We dive deep into poor Christian music substitutes, the balance between tour and “real” life back at home and the life of a mid-level band. Please relax for a moment with me while we all distract ourselves from the nightmare onslaught of news. Enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Val Loper from Bear Hands/Rubbing Alcohol and In Pieces
item.itunes:title: Val Loper from Bear Hands/Rubbing Alcohol and In Pieces
item.description:
Episode 241 - We survived the inauguration and are back for another week of insightful conversation with people involved in independent music. This week we have my old friend, Val Loper on the show. He plays in a rock band called Bear Hands (and a killer solo project called Rubbing Alcohol) and once upon a time, played in a melodic hardcore band called In Pieces. We talk the strange experience of playing radio festivals, playing in the indie rock world and drinking. It’s a frank and honest discussion of all things being in a band and I loved it. Have fun! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Josh Brigham from Hopesfall
item.description:
Episode 240 - Great show today with Josh Brigham from Hopesfall talking to me about melodic hardcore, religion and ultimately, not fitting in. Hopesfall was an important band to me and many others in the late 90’s and early 2000’s that were doing something slightly unconventional in combining atmospheric rock with melodic hardcore and pulled it off with great affect. Dive in and enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.title: James McKean from Departures
item.itunes:title: James McKean from Departures
item.description:
Episode 238 - Happy 2017! As we enter the 6th year of this podcast, I am continually humbled by all of your support so THANK YOU! On the show this week is James McKean the vocalist from hardcore band Departures. They put out one of my favorite records of last year and I was delighted to speak to him. We talk about life in Scotland, his love for musicals and his feelings on Brexit to a dumb american (me). Pull up a chair, grab a cup of coffee and lets dive in! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Best of 2016 w/ Joey Cahill and Jeremy Bolm
item.itunes:title: Best of 2016 w/ Joey Cahill and Jeremy Bolm
item.description:
Episode 237 - BEST OF 2016. It’s the huge one that many of you were waiting for. Sit back, grab a cup of coffee and enjoy this lengthy conversation about our favorite records of the year. Myself, Joey Cahill (6131 Records) and Jeremy Bolm (Touche Amore) talk about the best music, movies and podcasts. Ray Harkins: 1. Daughter - Not To Disappear 2. Touche Amore - Stage Four 3. Tycho - Epoch 4. Stranger Things Soundtrack V.1 & V.2 5. Departures - Death Touches Us, From The Moment We Begin To Love 6. Moose Blood - Blush 7. Chance the Rapper - Coloring Book 8. Bon Iver - 22, A Million 9. Nothing - Tired of Tomorrow 10. Wojciech Golczewski - End of Transmission Jeremy Bolm: 1. Leonard Cohen - You Want It Darker 2. Culture Abuse - Peach 3. Conor Oberst - Ruminations 4. Angel Olsen - My Woman 5. Nothing - Tired of Tomorrow 6. Angel Du$t - Rock The Fuck On Forever 7. Sun Kil Moon / Jesu 8. John K Samson - Winter Wheat 9. Deftones - Gore 10. Planes Mistaken For Stars - Prey Joey Cahill: 1. Dmas - Hills End 2. Lapsley - Long Way Home 3. Touche Amore - Stage Four 4. Pup - The Dream Is Over 5. Panic! At the disco - Death of a Bachelor 6. Bon Iver - 22, a Million 7. Conor Oberst - Ruminations 8. Jimmy eat world - Integrity Blues 9. Tribe Called Quest - We Got It From Here...Thank You 4 Your Service 10. Minor Victories - s/t

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Andy Hurley from Fall Out Boy/Sect
item.itunes:title: Andy Hurley from Fall Out Boy/Sect
item.description:
Episode 236 - The year is closing but that doesn’t mean we can’t have an amazing discussion with arguably one of the biggest guests in the shows history. Andy Hurley from Fall Out Boy, Sect, RaceTraitor and many more jumps on Skype with me one afternoon to discuss SO many things including but not limited to dealing with fame, friends as family and radical politics. It’s a wide ranging discussion that even uncovers a rumor that had been floating around since 2008 and we finally have it confirmed.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Evan Weiss from Into It. Over It.
item.itunes:title: Evan Weiss from Into It. Over It.
item.description:
Episode 233 - Hooray! It’s my good friend Evan Weiss from Into It. Over It. (and a million other bands) on the pod today. We hopped on the phone one afternoon and talked about technology, sports, growing older and DIY culture. It’s wide ranging, positive and thoughtful which is something that I know we all need at this point. Also, you can hear about my personal struggles going on in my life currently. Please keep me and my family in your thoughts/prayers moving forward as we absolutely need it. Attend Berklee School of Music online and get knowledgeable about the music business, performing and more!Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Matt Mixon, filmmaker/7 Angels & 7 Plagues
item.itunes:title: Matt Mixon, filmmaker/7 Angels & 7 Plagues
item.description:
Episode 230 - Every week I feel so lucky to speak to creative and inspiring individuals, and today is no different. Matt Mixon is a filmmaker and the vocalist from 7 Angels 7 Plagues who also put together an incredible documentary about his close friends in Misery Signals entitled, “Yesterday Was Everything”. It’s truly a special look at not only that band but how people’s lives are profoundly impacted by music. We also discuss early tour life and the importance of nostalgia. Dive in and enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
Episode 230 - Every week I feel so lucky to speak to creative and inspiring individuals, and today is no different. Matt Mixon is a filmmaker and the vocalist from 7 Angels 7 Plagues who also put together an incredible documentary about his close friends in Misery Signals entitled, “Yesterday Was Everything”. It’s truly a special look at not only that band but how people’s lives are profoundly impacted by music. We also discuss early tour life and the importance of nostalgia. Dive in and enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Episode 226 - Kevin Devine. That name should mean something to you and if it doesn’t then listen up. He’s a Brooklyn based singer-songwriter-artist-cool dude that previously played in a band called The Miracle of 86. He’s incredibly thoughtful and I loved every moment of this conversation. item.itunes:title: George Hirsch from Blacklisted/Harm Wülf
item.description:
Episode 224 - Some people I have on my “want list” for quite some time that they become a white whale for me and fall into another category of “that’d be nice if it would happen one day”. Today, one of those guests came to fruition and I am so glad to bring it to you. George Hirsch from Harm Wülf/Blacklisted spoke to me for about an hour on everything from conflict on tour to motivation and being vulnerable. item.description:
Episode 223 - This is the most unique podcast I have done to date. Patrick Kindlon is the vocalist for Self Defense Family and Drug Church. He’s a man of many talents and was one of my most requested guests on social media and finally, we have him on. We have a wide ranging discussion about internet culture, context and racist music. item.title: Greg Antonni from The Bouncing Souls/Play Date
item.itunes:title: Greg Antonni from The Bouncing Souls/Play Date
item.description:
Holy wow! I can’t believe that the singer of The Bouncing Souls, Greg Antonni, is on the show today! If you don’t know who The Bouncing Souls are please check your pulse as they are probably one of the best punk bands around today and potentially of all time. Greg opens up to us about his life in and around New Jersey, the major label rush of the 90’s as well as his “kid music” project with his wife Play Date. It’s always refreshing to know that no matter how long you’ve been doing something, you can still be enthusiastic about the future and Greg is a shining example of that. Consider being a Bone Marrow donor, like me. Join the registry today.Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.itunes:title: James Vitalo from Backtrack
item.description:
Hard work and hustle. That’s what I think of when I look at my friend, James Vitalo. He’s the vocalist of Backtrack and manager for the band Turnstile and a person who’s taken what he’s learned and built his life around it. We discuss how he was attached to one of the most traumatic events in my life, mischief and the grind of tour. James came ready to share and because of that, we have an incredible conversation. item.description:
Episode 219 - If heavy music is your thing, odds are that this man has had his hands on it. Brad Boatright is the talent behind the knobs at his studio, Audiosiege as well as the guitarist/vocalist of crust legends From Ashes Rise. item.title: Lee Overtree from The Story Pirates
item.itunes:title: Lee Overtree from The Story Pirates
item.description:
Episode 217 - Do you like improv comedy? How about theatre? Well I love both of these things and was excited to speak to Lee Overtree, who is the creative director behind Story Pirates in New York City. His program takes stories written by kids and turns them into stage shows/radio plays. Lee also has a history within independent music and was influenced heavily by the DIY emo/punk scene. It’s what I like to call one of my favorite “secret punk” episodes in which a person who isn’t necessarily doing anything that you’d immediately define as punk, but under the surface is completely punk. We discuss how his life was changed by Jon Stewart (yes, THE John Stewart), making art for kids and the DIY mentality. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Andy Othling from Lowercase Noises
item.itunes:title: Andy Othling from Lowercase Noises
item.description:
One of the more introspective and interesting conversations on the podcast I have ever had with Andy Othling from Lowercase Noises. He is a one man band from Albuquerque, New Mexico and his music is beautiful, haunting and trance inducing. After getting to know him a bit, I knew he’d be a great guest for the show and he did not disappoint. We speak in depth about solitude, computer science and the creative process. I urge you to listen to this episode as we go down roads that I think many people would be able to relate with. Enjoy! Listen to the best summer playlist couresty of Amazon Prime Music!Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Thomas Pearson from Foundation
item.itunes:title: Thomas Pearson from Foundation
item.description:
Episode 215 - Foundation was one of my favorite hardcore bands in recent years, so I was very much looking forward to speaking to Thomas Pearson, the vocalist of said band. We hopped on Skype one afternoon and had a great discussion about the Atlanta hardcore scene, the process of being a teacher and frankly, why independent music is the best. While I am sad the band is no longer, they left a great legacy in their recorded music. Listen and enjoy! item.description:

item.title: Vinnie Caruana from The Movielife & I Am The Avalanche
item.itunes:title: Vinnie Caruana from The Movielife & I Am The Avalanche
item.description:
Vinnie Caruana is my new best friend. We had such an awesome time chatting for the show I didn’t want to let him go at the end of our hour. He’s best known for being the singer of bands like The Movielife & I Am The Avalanche but also has an incredibly prolific solo output as well. We discussed Long Island hardcore, corporate songwriting and the early touring years of his life. As Vinnie states towards the end of the show, “Memory lane is a good place to visit”. Try two meals FREE with Blue Apron. It’s simply a better way to cook.SeatGeek is the best place to buy tickets online. item.title: Jesse Leach from Killswitch Engage
item.itunes:title: Jesse Leach from Killswitch Engage
item.description:
Episode 211 - Jesse Leach has always fascinated me. As the singer of Killswitch Engage I found his lyrics to be positive and uplifting in ways that most metal bands didn’t embrace and I loved it. I hop in the bands tour bus and pick his brain about anxiety, showing your roots and ultimately finding comfort. It’s a very special conversation that I am pleased to bring you. Try two meals FREE with Blue Apron. It’s simply a better way to cook.SeatGeek is the best place to buy tickets online. item.title: Jasamine White-Gluz from No Joy
item.itunes:title: Jasamine White-Gluz from No Joy
item.description:
Episode 210 - No Joy! Sounds like a dour way to start a podcast but Jasamine White-Gluz from No Joy is on the show today. She is the lead vocalist and guitarist for the Montreal based indie rock band. As you can hear from the chat, her and I have known about each other for awhile but finally were able to connect for this great discussion. We dive into the French/Canadian music scene, alt-rock beginnings and what it’s like to manage models (!). A wide variety of topics that I am happy to bring you. SeatGeek is the best place to buy tickets online. Download the app and use the code WORDS for a $20 rebate off of your first purchase.Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.title: Tom Williams from Stray From the Path
item.itunes:title: Tom Williams from Stray From the Path
item.description:
Episode 209 - It’s Tom Williams day on the pod! I speak to my old friend who plays guitar in the band Stray From the Path about many things including his early work ethic (and still today), why his band is so rooted in speaking about politics and politically charged issues as well as being professional and not coming off like a needy band when asking for help. It’s a really inspiring chat for a band that has been working for a long time to make an impact.SeatGeek is the best place to buy tickets online. item.title: Daryl Taberski from Snapcase
item.itunes:title: Daryl Taberski from Snapcase
item.description:
IT’S OUR 4 YEAR ANNIVERSARY! CELEBRATE! This week is very special for me as I bring on Daryl Taberski, the vocalist from Snapcase. They are one of my favorite bands of all time and I never would have had an excuse to talk to Daryl if it wasn’t for this podcast but we discuss many incredible things like the formation of the band, the days where the band was courted by major labels and the evolution of the bands sound. It’s a lengthy conversation but well worth your time. Please spread the word on this show and tell your friends about it. I want to make this one of the largest episodes in the shows history. Thanks for listening all of these years, I really appreciate all of you. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: NBA Shootaround with Benny Horowitz (from The Gaslight Anthem)
item.itunes:title: NBA Shootaround with Benny Horowitz (from The Gaslight Anthem)
item.description:
Episode 207 - Basketball talk? On a music podcast? As part of my ongoing “friendversation” series I wanted to bring a recent guest back on the show to dive into one of my favorite sports, basketball. If you are looking for a discussion of independent music you will have to look elsewhere this week. Benny and I discuss how we both got into basketball, the current NBA playoffs, the upcoming draft and some quick “emotional response” questions I wanted to ask. I had a lot of fun with this and hope you enjoy this slight diversion from the norm. Next week, is our 4 year anniversary and I am incredibly excited about that. Have a good week! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Astronautalis, hip-hop artist
item.itunes:title: Astronautalis, hip-hop artist
item.description:
Meet your new friend Astronautalis! He’s a hip hop artist from Minneapolis that has a rich history within independent music as you will hear from the show. We talk about his first tour ever, The Vans Warped Tour (which is insane), freestyle rap being a parlor trick and rave culture in the 90’s. It’s a bit of a different discussion than the show typically has, but a very engaging and interesting one. Check out his new LP on Side One Dummy called Cut The Body Loose as it is really, REALLY good. Enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Matt Johnson, author and ex-Preacher Gone To Texas
item.itunes:title: Matt Johnson, author and ex-Preacher Gone To Texas
item.description:
Have you ever wanted to know what it’s like inside the Pentagon? Or what it’s like to write a book? Let me good friend Matt Johnson tell you. He was the vocalist for hardcore bands Preacher Gone To Texas and Ignite the Will and one of the smartest people I know. He knows how to tell a story and that’s exactly why he’s on the show this week. We discuss all of those points and life in the midwest. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Benny Horowitz from The Gaslight Anthem
item.description:
Episode 204 - Meet your new best friend, Benny Horowitz, the drummer for The Gaslight Anthem. I have loved the band for quite some time and really found Benny to be insightful and funny on other interviews I have heard him do. I DM’d him on Twitter and now, you have this conversation as a result. We discuss MANY things including him putting on shows in New Jersey, the notion of “punk rock guilt” and being a new father. Settle in and enjoy! Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

item.title: Buddy Nielsen from Senses Fail (Friendversation)
item.itunes:title: Buddy Nielsen from Senses Fail (Friendversation)
item.description:
Episode 203 - In our monthly series of “friendversations” I bring on my good friend, Buddy Nielsen from Senses Fail on the show to discuss how to exist in the internet. We speak in depth about the hatred that exists on the internet, expressing your opinion online and the unknowns of how this technology will affect us moving forward. We also discuss his new band (!!!), recently finding out he is going to be a father and MUCH more. I always love hanging out with Buddy and this conversation is no exception. Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Sammy Siegler from World Be Free, Youth of Today, Gorilla Biscuits, Glassjaw etc…
item.itunes:title: Sammy Siegler from World Be Free, Youth of Today, Gorilla Biscuits, Glassjaw etc…
item.description:
Episode 202 - Hands down one of my favorite drummers, Sammy Siegler, makes his appearance on the show this week. He’s played in Gorilla Biscuits, Youth of Today, Side By Side, Glassjaw, Rival Schools, Limp Bizkit (!) and currently plays in World Be Free. Needless to say, the guy is prolific and we dive DEEP into his life in and around music from his days as a 12 year old in NYC, how he collaborates with such a wide range of musicians and keeping your eyes open for opportunities. Sammy was very gracious with his time and I hope you enjoy the conversation. - - Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Kliph Nesteroff, author
item.itunes:title: Kliph Nesteroff, author
item.description:
A spectacular episode this week with author, Kliph Nesterhoff. He wrote a book called The Comedians that examines the forgotten about history from the early 1900’s all the way up to modern day stand up comedy. Kliph also has a history with punk rock and hardcore and modeled his own stand up comedy after it. I am always excited to shine a light on the intersection of two things that might not be considered “connected” but this episode shows it in spades.- - Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Damian Abraham from Fucked Up & Turned Out A Punk podcast
item.itunes:title: Damian Abraham from Fucked Up & Turned Out A Punk podcast
item.description:
I find it incredible that this thing has lasted for 200 episodes and we have quite a guest for you today in the form of Damien Abraham from Fucked Up (and incredible podcast, Turned Out A Punk). We’ve known each other for a long time and really dove deep into obsession, anxiety and what it feels like to “sell out” straight edge. No stone is left unturned and we even get some insight on what the mentality is like behind the unconventional band that Fucked Up is. What a time to be alive people, sit back and enjoy! - - - Check out Equal Vision Records and the new Say Anything record, called “I Don’t Think It Is” and get 15% off any order by using the code PODCAST!Visit our sponsor Harry’s and use the code 100WORDS for $5 off your first order. Amazing razors at a great price!Use our Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Bo Thomson from Das Bootleg & Donnybrook
item.itunes:title: Bo Thomson from Das Bootleg & Donnybrook
item.description:
Episode 199 - Let’s face it, clothing brands are a dime a dozen and it takes a lot in this day and age to do anything unique or eye catching but fortunately, this weeks guest does. Bo is an old friend that runs a clothing company called Das Bootleg which does amazing music/pop culture references that you have to see to believe. It’s basically a calling card to the world that you are into some cool stuff. Bo, like many other guests has his roots in punk/hardcore and uses the same principals in running his business and we discuss that, hockey and pressing the reset button. It’s a must listen for anyone striving for creative outlets but struggling as Bo turned his idea, into something special. - - Use our special promo code 100wordsorless on Das Bootleg for 20% off your order. For listeners of the show only! Use this Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.content:encoded:
Episode 199 - Let’s face it, clothing brands are a dime a dozen and it takes a lot in this day and age to do anything unique or eye catching but fortunately, this weeks guest does. Bo is an old friend that runs a clothing company called Das Bootleg which does amazing music/pop culture references that you have to see to believe. It’s basically a calling card to the world that you are into some cool stuff. Bo, like many other guests has his roots in punk/hardcore and uses the same principals in running his business and we discuss that, hockey and pressing the reset button. It’s a must listen for anyone striving for creative outlets but struggling as Bo turned his idea, into something special. - - Use our special promo code 100wordsorless on Das Bootleg for 20% off your order. For listeners of the show only! Use this Amazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Cameron Miller from Seizures
item.itunes:title: Cameron Miller from Seizures
item.description:
This week is a doozy. Cameron Miller sings for a band called Seizures who will pummel your ear drums with their Botch-esque metal influenced hardcore but more importantly, he has a crazy life story. Cameron and I discuss depression, a harrowing life experience and practicing happiness. It's a very deep and compelling conversation that I urge you to check out. I am very appreciative to Cameron for wanting to express these feelings on the show. --Use ourAmazon Affiliate Code to support the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Mike Minnick, Friendversation
item.itunes:title: Mike Minnick, Friendversation
item.description:
I am pleased to bring you another installment of the monthly "friendversation" series that will happen throughout 2016. This time I call up my friend Mike Minnick who you may know from Curl Up and Die, Puig Destroyer and his recent project, Less Art (which I forget in the intro like the true professional I am). We discuss the importance of live music, writing lyrics and a bunch of other stuff. Sit back, relax and enjoy. -- This weeks show is brought to you by Adam & Eve want to make your Valentines Day spectacular. item.title: Jon Bunch from Sensefield, Reason To Believe, Further Seems Forever & War Generation (REBROADCAST)
item.itunes:title: Jon Bunch from Sensefield, Reason To Believe, Further Seems Forever & War Generation (REBROADCAST)
item.description:
This sucks. I didn't think I would have to consider rebroadcasting any of these interviews that I have done over the course of the past few years but Jon Bunch passed away recently and I immediately thought this was appropriate to revisit the incredible conversation I had at Jon's house back in 2013. My thoughts go out to his family and everyone affected by this tremendous loss. He was one of my favorite vocalists of all time and we should all collectively thank his memory for his contributions to our little scene.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Josh Coll from Foxing
item.itunes:title: Josh Coll from Foxing
item.description:
Foxing are a great band. Their new record Dealer made my top 10 list for 2015 so it only made sense to me that I get to know them a bit better. Josh Coll plays bass in the band (and contributes a portion of the lyrics as well) and we spoke one afternoon over Skype. It was a delightful discussion about coping with attention being paid to your band, the military and the Midwest. Please do enjoy. - - This weeks show is brought to you by Adam & Eve want to make your Valentines Day spectacular. item.title: Leroy Payne, my grandfather
item.itunes:title: Leroy Payne, my grandfather
item.description:
This is a definite left turn for the show, but something I needed to do. My grandfather, Roy Payne passed away last week. I've been entrenched in emotion, cleaning out his house and processing the loss. I had an interview I conducted with him back in 2011 about his 95 years on this planet and regardless of the lack of personal connection you may have with him, his story is universal. People of "the greatest generation" have stories that will blow your minds and I didn't want this to be something only my family shared. Please enjoy and as a "bonus" you can hear my son and I be goofy at the end of the podcast. Thanks for your well wishes and next week, we will be back to our regularly scheduled program.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Stephanie Marlow, indie PR
item.itunes:title: Stephanie Marlow, indie PR
item.description:
I sat down with my long time friend Stephanie Marlow who has a long history with independent music and runs a very successful PR company of her own that has worked with everyone from Deafheaven to Pallbearer to Have Heart. She has a great story and I was excited to turn the tables on her and interview her which is a position she's not normally put in. Enjoy!

item.title: Best of 2015 w/ Joey Cahill
item.itunes:title: Best of 2015 w/ Joey Cahill
item.description:
It's that time of year again, our annual "Best of" episode! While we are missing a good friend (Jeremy Bolm) due to circumstances and timing, this is still a fun review on the best music, movies and TV (and podcasts) from the year that was. Joey and I run through our top ten records of the year and will hopefully give you enough listening for the next few months. Thanks again for all your support in 2015 and we have even more great shows lined up in 2016! Ray's Top 10Top 10 Records 1. Beach Slang - The Things We Do To Find People Who Feel Like Us 2. Turnover - Peripheral Vision 3. Zombi - Shape Shift 4. Jamie XX - In Colour 5. It Follows Soundtrack by Disasterpiece 6. Sufjan Stevens - Carrie & Lowell 7. Ex Machina Soundtrack by Ben Sailisbury and Geoff Barlow 8. Leon Bridges - Coming Home 9. Julien Baker - Sprained Ankle 10. Foxing - Dealer Joey's Top 101. Sufjan Stevens - Carrie & Lowell 2. Natalie Prass - S/T 3. Leon Bridges - Coming Home 4. Joanna Newsom - Divers 5. Beach Slang - The Things We Do To Find People Who Feel Like Us 6. Royal headache - High 7. Hop Along - Painted Shut 8. Turnstile - Nonstop Feeling 9. The Tallest Man On Earth - Dark Bird Is Home 10. Joey Bada$$ - B4.DA.$$

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Nick "Biggie" Grimaldi from Good Fight Management
item.itunes:title: Nick "Biggie" Grimaldi from Good Fight Management
item.description:
A long time friend is my guest this week in the form of Nick Grimaldi, or what many know him as "Biggie". He is a manager of most of your favorite bands like Between the Buried and Me, Every Time I Die, Circa Survive, Bless The Fall, Terror and MANY others. We dive deep into his introduction to working in the music industry as a merch slinger for Eighteen Visions and Throwdown and eventually Every Time I Die as well as his personal upbringing. It's a really deep conversation that I was happy to have and ultimately bring to you! -- -Follow the show on TwitterEmail the show: 100wordspodcast@gmail.com 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Friendversation w/ Joey Cahill
item.itunes:title: Friendversation w/ Joey Cahill
item.description:
Episode 186.5 - As a "bonus" episode during the holidays, I decided to try something a bit different with this. I gave my best friend Joey Cahill a call and we went off on a few different subjects like the death of Rdio, trademarking everything and the issues that are plaguing the vinyl pressing plants and record labels attempting to manufacture vinyl. We also bring up two buried treasures of bands that we feel need more attention. Pull up a chair and join us!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Mark Palm from Supercrush, Devotion and Go It Alone
item.itunes:title: Mark Palm from Supercrush, Devotion and Go It Alone
item.description:
Episode 185 - Mark Palm is on the show this week and he has played in many bands including the seminal hardcore band Go It Alone as well as metal/thrash heroes Black Breath while also traveling the world on his own. He currently plays in a band called Supercrush while also still pursuing his solo project called Devotion. He's an incredibly interesting person and we dive deep into what the life of a wanderer is like, defying conventions and always pushing yourself. - - -This weeks show is brought to you by Zevia, the zero calorie, naturally sweetened soda. item.title: Andy Williams from Every Time I Die
item.itunes:title: Andy Williams from Every Time I Die
item.description:
We dive deep with one of the largest characters in independent music today, Andy Williams. He plays guitar in Every Time I Die and is a total diehard "road dog". We discuss the notion of being an entertainer while playing in a band, why he still likes touring so much and festivals. I also confront him on an old experience that I had with him some 15 years ago. It's a must listen so come on in.

item.itunes:title: Mark Brickey from the Adventures In Design Podcast
item.description:
A split 7" as it were! Podcast hosts collide and we have on the show today, Mark Brickey who hosts the spectacular show called Adventures In Design which focuses on design, art and the ability to make a living out of it. While the format may be a bit unconventional (we wander many different places) it's a discussion that enlightened me many times and I hope it does the same for you. item.title: Adam Blake from H2O & Shelter
item.itunes:title: Adam Blake from H2O & Shelter
item.description:
Episode 180 - Sometimes the most unexpected conversations are the best ones. I had hung out with Adam a few times before and he was a real charming lad, but little did I know his life story was incredible and his connection to one of my favorite records ever (Shelter's MANTRA) made this chat real deep. We discuss music being the center of our lives, manifesting your own destiny and personal training. It's a deep one, so buckle up and enjoy.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Lennon Livesay from Blistered/Ecostrike
item.description:
Part of our continuing "Faces of Modern Hardcore" series, I spoke to Lennon Livesay who is the vocalist of the hardcore band Blistered. We discuss the bizarre world of Florida, what it's like to build a scene and the hard work it takes to get your band out there. If you aren't familiar with the bands work, now is your time to jump in.

item.title: Will Potter, author of Green Is The New Red & TED Fellow
item.itunes:title: Will Potter, author of Green Is The New Red & TED Fellow
item.description:
Will Potter is on the show this week and he's incredibly smart. He's a published author with a great book (called Green Is The New Red) on the animal agriculture industry and how the people who rally against it are considered domestic terrorists as well as an accomplished public speaker with two TED talks underneath his belt. In this episode Will and I discuss the romantic notions of some professions, high pressure situations and activism in general. It's a chat I am proud to present to you fine folk. item.title: Ben Pobjoy from Hot Charity Records
item.itunes:title: Ben Pobjoy from Hot Charity Records
item.description:
I am extremely excited to bring you this in depth conversation with an old friend and a person who's work ethic and artistic expression I hold in great regard. Ben Pobjoy runs a record label called Hot Charity Records (a division of XL Recordings) as well as working ad an ad agency in Toronto while also managing the band Single Mothers. Ben has a long history in punk/hardcore and played in some important bands like Spread The Disease and The Abandoned Hearts Club when he was younger. Our conversation goes all over the place but we discuss art, creativity and the concept of "faking it until you make it". Visit Squarespace and make that idea you've had come to life in the form of a beautiful website. item.itunes:title: Patrick O'Connor from The Dan Patrick Show
item.description:
Sports and punk? The idea of both of these mixing may have seemed foreign many years ago but now, not so much. I had Patrick O'Connor on the show this week and he's a sports commentator/co-host on The Dan Patrick show which is arguably one of the most influential sports shows on today, and it's totally DIY. Patrick and I discuss jock mentality, his upbringing in New York/New Jersey and his guidance counselor's horrible advice. item.title: Kevin Bergeron from Waxwork Records
item.itunes:title: Kevin Bergeron from Waxwork Records
item.description:
In our ongoing series focusing on independent record labels, we have Kevin Bergeron from Waxwork Records on the show. Waxwork Records is an independent, soundtrack focused label that has put out some amazing titles like Friday the 13th, Creepshow and some more recent scores from Starry Eyes and Phase IV. Kevin comes from a punk/hardcore background so I had to have him on. We discussed DIY culture, living in New Orleans and of course, soundtracks. MONTHLY DONATIONONE TIME DONATION

item.title: Graham Nixon from Resist Records & Manager of Parkway Drive
item.itunes:title: Graham Nixon from Resist Records & Manager of Parkway Drive
item.description:
Episode 165 - Sorry for the break last week, but I needed a break and well you just have to deal with it. We are back with glimpse at the life of a record label outside of the United States. I rang up Graham Nixon from Resist Records, as well as the manager of metal-core giants Parkway Drive, to discuss finding what you are passionate about, representing an entire country to the music world and one of my favorite subjects, golf. It's a great insight to how things operate on an international level within independent music. MONTHLY DONATIONONE TIME DONATION

item.title: Chris Wrenn from Bridge 9 Records
item.itunes:title: Chris Wrenn from Bridge 9 Records
item.description:
Episode 164 - Bridge Nine is an institution. Now, 20 years in the label is synonymous with hardcore, punk and above all, quality. The owner of the label, Chris Wrenn, and I spoke over Skype one afternoon about many things including dedication to independent music, guerrilla marketing in Boston to get the labels name out there and finally, hustle. It’s a very inspiring listen for anyone wanting to get their creative juices flowing. This episode is brought to you by Epitaph Records and their new release from Refused entitled Freedom. MONTHLY DONATIONONE TIME DONATION

item.itunes:title: Fred Feldman from Triple Crown Records
item.description:
We kickoff the month of record label profiles with one of the more interesting cases of success with Fred Feldman and his Triple Crown Records. We spend a lot of time discussing eclectic taste and how that reflected in the labels beginnings, working with hip-hop with his previous label and of course, Brand New. It's a really insightful conversation with a person who I have always admired and respected his work. Won't you join us? item.title: Karl Buechner from Earth Crisis
item.itunes:title: Karl Buechner from Earth Crisis
item.description:
This one was a long time in the making. I wasn't sure how willing Karl would be in wanting to open up about his musical upbringing, detailed experience with Earth Crisis and many other things but, he was nothing but accommodating. Karl is the vocalist for seminal hardcore band Earth Crisis who shaped the way people think about animals, straight edge and politics in general for the better part of 20 years. We talk about all of these things as well as Karl's experience teaching and more. I am humbled by this chat and hope you enjoy the places we go. MONTHLY DONATIONONE TIME DONATION

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: John O’Callaghan from The Maine
item.description:
Episode 159 - This week we dive into a deep discussion with the frontman of the pop/rock band The Maine. It's a bit left of center guest but John loves the show and approached me about being on it. We discuss what it's like being a sensitive kid, perseverance and the positive side of fan fiction. It's a very introspective discussion that I wasn't expecting to have, but am glad we did. item.title: Shane Told from Silverstein
item.itunes:title: Shane Told from Silverstein
item.description:
This week I speak to my old friend and vocalist for the band Silverstein, Shane Told. For as long as I have known him, there were many things that I simply had no clue he experienced. We discuss managing expectations, his own identity and neglecting Canada at the beginning of the bands career. It's an incredibly open and honest discussion that I was glad Shane decided to have with me. THIS IS OUR FUNDRAISING MONTH. This is it, my number one guest that I had written down close to three years ago when I started this podcast was the vocalist/guitarist from one of my favorite bands of all time, Jimmy Eat World. item.title: Dallas Green from City And Colour/Alexisonfire/You+Me
item.itunes:title: Dallas Green from City And Colour/Alexisonfire/You+Me
item.description:
This is a doozy. On the show this week is solo artist Dallas Green. He previously played in post-hardcore band Alexisonfire which is where I became really close with him. I've wanted Dallas on the show for quite some time but honestly, didn't really want to waste his time until this show grew organically. We discussed the idea of celebrity, anxiety and reflecting on his creative life. Highly personal and for me, deeply emotional. Thanks for listening. THIS IS OUR FUNDRAISING MONTH. IF YOU LIKE WHAT YOU HEAR, OR ARE A REGULAR LISTENER PLEASE CONSIDER DONATING. EVEN $1 A MONTH HELPS. MONTHLY DONATIONONE TIME DONATION

item.title: Scott Shriner from Weezer
item.itunes:title: Scott Shriner from Weezer
item.description:
This week on the show is Scott Shriner who is the bassist of the rock band Weezer. Scott was kind enough to invite me over to his house to discuss his time in the marines, being open to change and how hard he had to work for years to randomly land where he is at now. Not to mention his time on the road with Vanilla Ice...yep, that one. He lends some amazing insight on what it takes to "make it" as a musician. THIS IS OUR FUNDRAISING MONTH. item.title: Nathan Gluck from Ensign
item.itunes:title: Nathan Gluck from Ensign
item.description:
Hardcore. Punk. Cancer. One of these things is not like the other. Nathan Gluck I've known for awhile and his band Ensign was monumentally important to me in my formative years of going to shows. Recently, he was diagnosed with stomach cancer and the hardcore community chipped in and raised over $100,000 for his medical expenses. It's a really incredible story and Nate was extremely candid about his time in Ensign and the fight he has going on currently. Very happy to bring this special episode to you. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Valentino Arteaga from Of Mice & Men
item.itunes:title: Valentino Arteaga from Of Mice & Men
item.description:
This episode is an illustration. Many regular listeners of the program might think "Why is this guy on?" and the simple answer is that he's a hardworking dude. Of Mice And Men may not be your cup of tea musically but no one can deny the work that it takes to arrive in a band like this. Tino (as his friends refer to him as) and I unwrap his journey from the early touring days signed to Ferret Music, taking an unconventional role in the band and showing "fans" that you are indeed a nerd just like everyone else. Toss aside any preconceived notions you may have of the band and dig into this crucial episode, Tino is the epitome of hardwork. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Jeff Casazza from Run For Cover Records
item.itunes:title: Jeff Casazza from Run For Cover Records
item.description:
This episode was a long time coming but our schedules finally matched up and I was able to chat with Jeff Casazza, the owner of Run For Cover Records. We get in depth about failing miserably at the beginning of the label, being a "boss" and how the internet played a huge part in Jeff's upbringing. Jeff was very forthcoming in his answers and it was a real pleasure to shed some light on areas of the label that often get overlooked. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Grey Gordon
item.itunes:title: Grey Gordon
item.description:
I had the pleasure of bringing on solo musician, Grey Gordon from Indiana. While Grey isn't a household name, his music is incredible and his wisdom at a young age shows that he has a story to tell. We discuss his upbringing with a punk father, the desire for connection and defying stereotypes. I urge you to check this episode out, even if you aren't familiar with his music as many lessons can be learned from this chat. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Branden Steineckert from Rancid
item.itunes:title: Branden Steineckert from Rancid
item.description:
Today on the show we have Branden Steineckert, who is the drummer for legendary punk band Rancid and founding member of The Used. This is a pretty deep and heavy conversation but an absolute must listen as he shares stories of drumming as therapy, building a scene and how suicide affected his life. I really appreciate Branden being as open and honest as he was. Special thanks to a previous guest of the show, Jay Weinberg, for initially bringing this up and my friend Jeff Bradley for helping this along. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Daniel Wonacott from Finch
item.itunes:title: Daniel Wonacott from Finch
item.description:
Finch was always a very mysterious band to me, I generally had no clue where they came from and if they were born out of any "scene" so to speak. In order to solve that mystery, I spoke to Daniel Wonacott, the bassist of the band (please excuse the fact I called him the guitarist in the intro of the episode), about those very mysteries. We discussed isolation, challenging their own fans as the band progressed and golf. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Kevin Duquette from Topshelf Records
item.itunes:title: Kevin Duquette from Topshelf Records
item.description:
While Kevin was out on the West Coast scouting out some places for Topshelf Records to relocate, I was able to meet up and get to know him a bit more. Kevin runs Topshelf Records alongside one of his close friends, Seth. We discussed not concentrating on negativity, finding your role and competition amongst record labels. I found it to be extremely engaging and I hope you do as well.

item.title: Chris Hannah from Propagandhi
item.itunes:title: Chris Hannah from Propagandhi
item.description:
This is a huge episode for me as Propagandhi is one of my favorite bands of all time. Chris and I discussed what it's like having academic papers written about your lyrics, nuance within one's life and being a parent. It got way more introspective than I thought it was going to be, but Chris was very open and ready to talk. He was one of the first people I wanted to speak to for the podcast, and 142 episodes later, we made it happen. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

Greg has many life lessons to teach so pull up a chair and listen.

item.title: Rocky Votolato
item.itunes:title: Rocky Votolato
item.description:
THIS EPISODE BROUGHT TO YOU EXCLUSIVELY BY ENJOY THE RIDE RECORDS (www.enjoytheriderecords.com). On the show this week is the hardworking singer/songwriter Rocky Votolato. Many may remember his incredible band Waxwing or his solo career that he's been crafting for the past 10+ years. Rocky has some incredible stories about being raised in/around a biker gang, how to remain positive and the fight with your ego. It's an incredibly introspective conversation and one I was really glad to have with him. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: BONUS HOLIDAY EPISODE - David Anthony from The AV Club
item.itunes:title: BONUS HOLIDAY EPISODE - David Anthony from The AV Club
item.description:
Happy Holidays everyone! I wanted to get you this awesome bonus episode here with David Anthony, the digital manager over at The AV Club. For regular listeners, you will notice his voice as he occasionally contributes some records for us to discuss that he might not have the ability to write about on the site. I sit down with him to speak about how exactly he got started in his writing career, his background and what keeps him inspired. This episode is an absolute must listen for anyone interested in writing about music or frankly, how to express themselves.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Nick Bogardus, ex-Thrice manager & Cross Of Christ Church
item.itunes:title: Nick Bogardus, ex-Thrice manager & Cross Of Christ Church
item.description:
Nick Bogardus is an extremely old friend and has lived most of his life directly connected to his passions, music & God. He managed Thrice, under his management company called New Noise, from their infancy to their meteoric rise in the early 2000's and beyond. He then walked away from the music industry to pursue his relationship with God and now is the pastor of his own church here in Orange County, CA called Cross of Christ. A very reflective conversation that I am glad to bring to you. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: Eddie Breckenridge from Thrice

We get to some pretty deep places and his outlook on creativity is inspiring.

item.title: Buddy Nielsen from Senses Fail
item.itunes:title: Buddy Nielsen from Senses Fail
item.description:
This is it. I never thought that this podcast would be a vehicle for such open and inspiring discussion, but here we are. Buddy Nielsen who is the vocalist for Senses Fail who for many years, was arguably one of the largest bands in the mid-aughts comes on the show to discuss his struggles. He opens up about his addictions, sexuality and the self-destructive behavior he inflicted on himself for years. He's never discussed these issues in a public form and it's incredible to hear the stories as well as the process of moving past that season in his life. I am extremely proud to bring this compelling conversation to you and thanks again to Buddy for wanting to share his story. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Calvin Philley from Xerxes - Episode 131
item.itunes:title: Calvin Philley from Xerxes - Episode 131
item.description:
This week I was able to speak to the lead vocalist in the punk outfit, Xerxes. Calvin was more than willing to open up about his creative writing past, depression and anxiety that he suffers from. It's unlike most previous episodes as we dive in deep right away and I even get a little Dad like towards the end of the show. Dive in and enjoy!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.content:encoded:
This week I was able to speak to the lead vocalist in the punk outfit, Xerxes. Calvin was more than willing to open up about his creative writing past, depression and anxiety that he suffers from. It's unlike most previous episodes as we dive in deep right away and I even get a little Dad like towards the end of the show. Dive in and enjoy!

item.title: James Shotwell from Under The Gun Review & Haulix - Episode 130
item.itunes:title: James Shotwell from Under The Gun Review & Haulix - Episode 130
item.description:
Many apologies for the delay, the internet wasn't our friend this week. Fortunately, I have a very fun conversation with James Shotwell who runs the site, Under The Gun Review , as well as working for a great music industry service called Haulix. We get in depth with discussions on the Christian music scene, is multi-tasking really a good thing and how playing terrible music is actually good for you. James was a great sport and up for discussing anything.

item.title: Walter Delgado from Rotting Out
item.itunes:title: Walter Delgado from Rotting Out
item.description:
In this very revealing episode we speak to Walter Delgado, the vocalist from the hardcore band Rotting Out. He had an insane upbringing and his life could have gone a completely different direction if it weren't for one specific show. We also discuss immigrating from Mexico, the horrific cycle of abuse and defying stereotypes. This is an absolutely crucial episode.

item.title: Allen Epley from The Life and Times/Shiner - Episode 128
item.itunes:title: Allen Epley from The Life and Times/Shiner - Episode 128
item.description:
Hey everyone! I am really excited to bring you this chat with Alley Epley, the guitarist/vocalist for The Life and Times & Shiner. While his bands aren't widely known, they are HIGHLY influential to indie rock, punk and hardcore. We discuss how to keep music fresh, The Blue Man Group and coming from a musical home. In this episode, we also check in with our contributor Dave Anthony (from The AV Club) about some recent releases that are worth your time to check out. Please contribute to the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Sam Carter from Architects
item.itunes:title: Sam Carter from Architects
item.description:
Late one evening the vocalist for Sam Carter, and I hopped on Skype and had a spirited discussion hitting many topics that include getting in trouble with the press, what it's like to almost break a band up and not having a "backup plan". Sam is one of my good friends and I felt like we were really able to get somewhere with this discussion. I hope you enjoy! Please Donate to the Show!

item.title: Andrew Koji Shiraki from Koji
item.itunes:title: Andrew Koji Shiraki from Koji
item.description:
The guest has been a long time coming but we finally have the incredible Koji a solo artist from Pennsylvania, on the show this week. He's an incredibly thoughtful guy that gave me a lot of time for us to discuss being an outsider, self-examination and continually keeping active. Not only does he create compelling music, but he is very passionate about creating communities around activism and ideas outside of music. He's a very valuable member of our independent music community and I hope you enjoy this conversation. Please donate to the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Dan Carlin from Hardcore History & Common Sense Podcast
item.itunes:title: Dan Carlin from Hardcore History & Common Sense Podcast
item.description:
I was nervous. This was an extremely important episode to me as Dan Carlin is someone who's work I really respect and view him as a true professional. His podcasts, Hardcore History and Common Sense, are staples of my listening diet and he has a long history with the world of punk and independent music. We speak about being reckless, the world of newscasting and the early 80's punk scene. This is essential listening. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com.Please Donate To the Show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Mike Mowery from Outerloop Management
item.itunes:title: Mike Mowery from Outerloop Management
item.description:
I am pleased to bring you my chat with my old friend, Mike Mowery. He currently manages bands under the Outerloop Management company and is responsible for bands like Refused, We Came As Romans, Set It Off and many more. He also used to play in Good Clean Fun as well as organize shows at The Pickle Patch in Santa Barbara, CA. He's done a lot with his time and was eager to speak about his experiences to me. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Nick Diener from The Swellers
item.itunes:title: Nick Diener from The Swellers
item.description:
THIS EPISODE BROUGHT TO YOU EXCLUSIVELY BY THE NATIVE SOUNDThe vocalist from The Swellers, Nick Diener, is my guest on the show this week and I couldn't be more happy to bring you this raw and honest conversation. We speak about what it's like to break a band up, the transitions that he is going through in his own life and jealousy between bands (which is something very few bands/people discuss publicly). Nick was extremely gracious in sharing his thoughts and we deliberately let all of the coverage of The Swellers break-up subside before this episode was released. Please donate to the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Taylor Madison from Superheaven
item.itunes:title: Taylor Madison from Superheaven
item.description:
This episode brought to you exclusively by The Native SoundI was finally able to peg down a guy who I had been wanting to chat with for quite some time, Taylor Madison from the rock band Superheaven (formerly known as Daylight). He's a great dude with a very dry sense of humor so we got along swimmingly when we first met. In this episode we discussed how it feels and what it's like to change the name of your band, step-parents and social media frustrations. It's a very open and honest chat that I am proud to bring you. Please donate to the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.description:
THIS EPISODE EXCLUSIVELY BROUGHT TO YOU BY NATIVE SOUND RECORDSI am extremely proud to bring you a conversation I had with the host of one of my favorite podcasts around, Roman Mars. item.title: Dan Smith, professional tattoo artist and Sharpshock
item.itunes:title: Dan Smith, professional tattoo artist and Sharpshock
item.description:
One afternoon I had the pleasure of speaking with tattoo artist Dan Smith about his many life experiences including his stint on reality TV, coming to the US and playing in hardcore and punk bands in Australia/New Zealand. We spoke at his shop Captured Tattoo in Tustin, CA which is an amazing place if you are ever in the Southern California area, you must visit. A very lively chat and one I won't soon forget. Please donate to the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: John Bradley from Dads
item.itunes:title: John Bradley from Dads
item.description:
One afternoon in Los Angeles, on the eve of their biggest tour to date, I met up with the drummer of the rock band Dads, John Bradley . Little did I know this conversation would be my most unscripted and off the cuff episode in the history of the podcast. We discussed controlling relationships, dealing with adversity and controlled humor. It's a chat that absolutely everyone should listen to. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.comPlease donate to the show!

item.description:
In this friendly and compelling chat with the vocalist of Coalesce, Sean Ingram, we discuss the factions that popped up between music scenes in the mid-90's, extreme beliefs and the most important legacy that he wants to leave on the world. Please donate to the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Justin Pearson from Retox/The Locust
item.itunes:title: Justin Pearson from Retox/The Locust
item.description:
One fine afternoon in San Diego, I found myself sitting in Justin Pearson's living room discussing the process of writing books, provoking reactions and the life of a gypsy. Justin has been the front man for many bands including Struggle, Swing Kids, The Locust and All Leather. His current band is called Retox and he also runs the independent record label called 31G. It's an incredible chat and I am excited to share with you. Please donate to the show!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Rob Moran from Unbroken/Narrows
item.itunes:title: Rob Moran from Unbroken/Narrows
item.description:
I traveled down to San Diego for a day to meet up with Rob Moran, the bassist from influential hardcore band Unbroken as well as his current project, Narrows. Rob is an old friend and it was great being able to walk him through his early touring experiences, viewing time as a resource and being a minority in independent music. Please donate to the show!

item.title: Kelen Capener from The Story So Far
item.itunes:title: Kelen Capener from The Story So Far
item.description:
Wow, we got really deep in this conversation with Kelen. He plays bass for The Story So Far who is one of the hottest bands currently around. We discuss math, suburb restlessness and introspection within creation. It honestly was one of the more introspective conversations I've ever had with this podcast and I hope you enjoy. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Una Kim from Keep Company - Episode 104
item.itunes:title: Una Kim from Keep Company - Episode 104
item.description:
Happy two year anniversary to the show! To commemorate, I had Una Kim from Keep Company who are an amazing shoe company in Los Angeles. Una has many roots within music and Keep has done cool collaborations with everyone from Bon Iver, Tegan & Sara and Animal Collective. We discuss the punk rock guilt trip, compartmentalization and DIY ethics. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Matt Carter from Emery
item.itunes:title: Matt Carter from Emery
item.description:
I am very pleased to bring you this very charming conversation that Matt Carter, the guitarist of Emery, and I had one afternoon. I will be the first to admit, I didn't follow the band that much in the past couple of years but was pleased to know they were still doing their thing and staying true to the convictions that they held when they formed the band. We discuss how NOT to start a band, being late to the game and how terrible Christian music is in general.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Michael Craver from Seahaven - Episode 97
item.itunes:title: Michael Craver from Seahaven - Episode 97
item.description:
I am proud to bring you this episode because it's a perfect example of how I want this podcast to function. Michael was a listener of the show, emailed me and we started a dialog. I come to find out he plays in Seahaven and then I immediately invite him to be on the show. We discuss having focus, dealing with anxiety and being creative. It was a very "musical" chat since Seahaven doesn't particularly do a lot of press so it's an honor to have him on. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Jon Vigil from The Ghost Inside
item.itunes:title: Jon Vigil from The Ghost Inside
item.description:
I love the ability to bring you a wide variety of guests from all walks of the independent music scene and today is no different. On the show is Jon Vigil the vocalist from modern metalcore heroes The Ghost Inside. Jon came over to my house and we discussed staying interested in music, touring hardships and gut check moments. It's a very revealing and honest chat about all of those topics and more. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
I love the ability to bring you a wide variety of guests from all walks of the independent music scene and today is no different. On the show is Jon Vigil the vocalist from modern metalcore heroes The Ghost Inside. Jon came over to my house and we discussed staying interested in music, touring hardships and gut check moments. It's a very revealing and honest chat about all of those topics and more. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Sean Bonner from Safecast
item.description:
One of my only guests who has done a TED Talk, Sean Bonner is the guest on the show this week. He previously worked at Victory Records, ran a independent record label and now runs a radiation testing device company called Safecast. Needless to say, the dude has done a lot and he was kind enough to sit down with me to discuss context, hacking and record label life. Brought to you EXCLUSIVELY by Revelation Records and their three new releases from Down To Nothing, Title Fight and The Rival Mob. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Steve Rennie, manager of Incubus & RenmanMB Music - Episode 77
item.itunes:title: Steve Rennie, manager of Incubus & RenmanMB Music - Episode 77
item.description:
This episode is presented by No Sleep Records. On a bit of a departure from your "typical" guest on the show, Steve Rennie is the manager of major rock band Incubus as well as the curator/instructor of his own music industry course called Renman Music. He invited me over to his house and we discussed the music business in general, motivation and (to my excitement) golf. For anyone interested in the music industry, this is required listening. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com and is a part of the How We Are Podcast Network (howweare.org).

item.title: Sam McPheeters from Born Against/Wrangler Brutes
item.itunes:title: Sam McPheeters from Born Against/Wrangler Brutes
item.description:
This show was a total mind blower for me as I got to speak to one of the more influential people within the mid-90's hardcore scene, Sam McPheeters. He fronted the highly polarizing band Born Against (as well as Men's Recovery Project) and later sang in Wrangler Brutes. He is also a highly prolific freelance writer and amazing author. Our conversation hit on perspective, anger and the writing process. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com
