item.title: Scott Vogel from Terror
item.itunes:title: Scott Vogel from Terror
item.description:
I had the pleasure of hanging out with Scott Vogel one afternoon at his house awhile ago and in short, it was awesome. Scott is one of the most prolific vocalists within the hardcore scene but most don't know anything about him beyond the energetic stage presence he has with his band Terror. We spoke about telemarketing, reputation and "lifers" within the scene. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Mike Minnick from Curl Up And Die
item.itunes:title: Mike Minnick from Curl Up And Die
item.description:
I sat down with my old friend Mike Minnick (the vocalist of Curl Up And Die) and discussed a great deal of things including why you are drawn to certain people, depression and transitioning into "real life" after being in a touring band. Mike was extremely candid and it's the first time he's talking about a lot of this stuff and I can't thank him enough for wanting to discuss it in a public forum like this.

item.itunes:title: Mish Way from White Lung
item.description:
FINALLY! We have our first female on the show and I couldn't be more excited to bring this interview to you. Mish Way is the vocalist for the amazing band White Lung (which you heard me gush about on the 2012 recap episode). She is also a fellow podcaster and freelance writer for Vice and many other publications. In short, she's awesome and I was able to discuss going to college, ice skating and being the black sheep of the family. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com

item.itunes:title: James Carroll from Make Do And Mend
item.description:
Make Do And Mend is an awesome band. James is an awesome dude. He sings for the band. Through the transitive property, I had to interview him for the show and we did just that when I was in Gainsville, Florida for The Fest. We sat down on a park bench and discussed Warped Tour, the perils of being in a relationship while on tour and living in a house full of brothers.

item.title: Keith Latinen from Empire! Empire! (I Was A Lonely Estate) & Count Your Lucky Stars - Episode 32
item.itunes:title: Keith Latinen from Empire! Empire! (I Was A Lonely Estate) & Count Your Lucky Stars - Episode 32
item.description:
Here is an interview I wanted to bring you for quite some time with Keith Latinen, vocalist from the band Empire! Empire! (I Was A Lonely Estate) and owner of Count Your Lucky Stars. I didn't know him at all, but within 10 minutes we were discussing playing in a band with your wife, how one defines success and when does a band make the next "move" up. A very revealing chat from a band that doesn't do a ton of interviews. Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com

item.title: Episode 26 - Cameron Argon aka Big Chocolate
item.itunes:title: Episode 26 - Cameron Argon aka Big Chocolate
item.description:
With this episode, I wanted to focus on the emerging electronic dance music scene and shed some light on one of the independent artists from that particular corner of the music world. Cameron and I discussed his unexpected life goals, his interest in law enforcement and how technology changes the way we communicate. Whether or not you like electronic music, this conversation was extremely engaging and honest. Brought to you by Propertyofzack.com

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Ray Harkins from Taken/Mikoto/Sound & Fury
item.itunes:title: Ray Harkins from Taken/Mikoto/Sound & Fury
item.description:
So, to "celebrate" the 25th episode of the show...I wanted to let people in on my life and who I am for better or worse. With the help of my good friend Scott Arnold, he interviewed me about advice to pass to younger generations (aka: my kid), my upbringing in Vegas and the breakup of Taken. Hope this isn't too self indulgent, and if it is...deal with it. (Brought to you in conjunction with Propertyofzack.com)

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:title: Josh Grabelle from Bullet Tooth/Trustkill Records
